h1. Pinterest REST API

Pinterest's REST API

*Version:* 5.14.0

----

{expand:Table of Contents - Click to expand}
{toc:printable=true|style=square|minLevel=2|maxLevel=3|type=list|outline=false|include=.*}
{expand}

h2. Endpoints


h3. adAccount/analytics
{panel:title=adAccount/analytics|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Get ad account analytics
    *Description:* Get analytics for the specified &lt;code&gt;ad_account_id&lt;/code&gt;, filtered by the specified options.
- The token&#39;s user_account must either be the Owner of the specified ad account, or have one of the necessary roles granted to them via &lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/share-and-manage-access-to-your-ad-accounts&quot;&gt;Business Access&lt;/a&gt;: Admin, Analyst, Campaign Manager.
- If granularity is not HOUR, the furthest back you can are allowed to pull data is 90 days before the current date in UTC time and the max time range supported is 90 days.
- If granularity is HOUR, the furthest back you can are allowed to pull data is 8 days before the current date in UTC time.

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=get|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/ad_accounts/{ad_account_id}/analytics{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |
----
h4. Parameters
h5. Path Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |ad_account_id |Unique identifier of an ad account. | String | (/) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  |



h5. Query Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |start_date |Metric report start date (UTC). Format: YYYY-MM-DD. Cannot be more than 90 days back from today. | date | (/) |null |  |  ||end_date |Metric report end date (UTC). Format: YYYY-MM-DD. Cannot be more than 90 days past start_date. | date | (/) |null |  |  ||columns |Columns to retrieve, encoded as a comma-separated string. **NOTE**: Any metrics defined as MICRO_DOLLARS returns a value based on the advertiser profile&#39;s currency field. For USD,($1/1,000,000, or $0.000001 - one one-ten-thousandth of a cent). it&#39;s microdollars. Otherwise, it&#39;s in microunits of the advertiser&#39;s currency.&lt;br/&gt;For example, if the advertiser&#39;s currency is GBP (British pound sterling), all MICRO_DOLLARS fields will be in GBP microunits (1/1,000,000 British pound).&lt;br/&gt;If a column has no value, it may not be returned | array[String] | (/) |null |  |  ||granularity |TOTAL - metrics are aggregated over the specified date range.&lt;br&gt; DAY - metrics are broken down daily.&lt;br&gt; HOUR - metrics are broken down hourly.&lt;br&gt;WEEKLY - metrics are broken down weekly.&lt;br&gt;MONTHLY - metrics are broken down monthly | Granularity | (/) |null |  |  ||click_window_days |Number of days to use as the conversion attribution window for a pin click action. Applies to Pinterest Tag conversion metrics. Prior conversion tags use their defined attribution windows. If not specified, defaults to &#x60;30&#x60; days. | Integer | (x) |30 |  | [0, 1, 7, 14, 30, 60] ||engagement_window_days |Number of days to use as the conversion attribution window for an engagement action. Engagements include saves, closeups, link clicks, and carousel card swipes. Applies to Pinterest Tag conversion metrics. Prior conversion tags use their defined attribution windows. If not specified, defaults to &#x60;30&#x60; days. | Integer | (x) |30 |  | [0, 1, 7, 14, 30, 60] ||view_window_days |Number of days to use as the conversion attribution window for a view action. Applies to Pinterest Tag conversion metrics. Prior conversion tags use their defined attribution windows. If not specified, defaults to &#x60;1&#x60; day. | Integer | (x) |1 |  | [0, 1, 7, 14, 30, 60] ||conversion_report_time |The date by which the conversion metrics returned from this endpoint will be reported. There are two dates associated with a conversion event: the date that the user interacted with the ad, and the date that the user completed a conversion event. | String | (x) |TIME_OF_AD_ACTION |  | [TIME_OF_AD_ACTION, TIME_OF_CONVERSION] |
----
h4. Responses

    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Green|title=200|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Success |
    	|| Response Type | array[AdAccountAnalyticsResponse_inner] |
    	|| Response Model | [array[AdAccountAnalyticsResponse_inner] Model|#array[AdAccountAnalyticsResponse_inner]ModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "Success",
  "content" : {
    "application/json" : {
      "schema" : {
        "$ref" : "#/components/schemas/AdAccountAnalyticsResponse"
      }
    }
  }
}{code} |
       


    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Orange|title=400|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Invalid ad account analytics parameters. |
    	|| Response Type | Error |
    	|| Response Model | [Error Model|#ErrorModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "Invalid ad account analytics parameters.",
  "content" : {
    "application/json" : {
      "schema" : {
        "$ref" : "#/components/schemas/Error"
      },
      "example" : {
        "code" : 400,
        "message" : "Invalid ad account analytics parameters."
      }
    }
  }
}{code} |
       


    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Red|title=0|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Unexpected error |
    	|| Response Type | Error |
    	|| Response Model | [Error Model|#ErrorModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "Unexpected error",
  "content" : {
    "application/json" : {
      "schema" : {
        "$ref" : "#/components/schemas/Error"
      }
    }
  }
}{code} |
       

{panel}



h3. adAccountTargetingAnalytics/get
{panel:title=adAccountTargetingAnalytics/get|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Get targeting analytics for an ad account
    *Description:* Get targeting analytics for an ad account.
For the requested account and metrics, the response will include the requested metric information
(e.g. SPEND_IN_DOLLAR) for the requested target type (e.g. &quot;age_bucket&quot;) for applicable values (e.g. &quot;45-49&quot;). &lt;p/&gt;
- The token&#39;s user_account must either be the Owner of the specified ad account, or have one
of the necessary roles granted to them via
&lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/share-and-manage-access-to-your-ad-accounts&quot;&gt;Business Access&lt;/a&gt;: Admin, Analyst, Campaign Manager.
- If granularity is not HOUR, the furthest back you can are allowed to pull data is 90 days before the current date in UTC time and the max time range supported is 90 days.
- If granularity is HOUR, the furthest back you can are allowed to pull data is 8 days before the current date in UTC time and the max time range supported is 3 days.

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=get|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/ad_accounts/{ad_account_id}/targeting_analytics{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |
----
h4. Parameters
h5. Path Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |ad_account_id |Unique identifier of an ad account. | String | (/) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  |



h5. Query Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |start_date |Metric report start date (UTC). Format: YYYY-MM-DD. Cannot be more than 90 days back from today. | date | (/) |null |  |  ||end_date |Metric report end date (UTC). Format: YYYY-MM-DD. Cannot be more than 90 days past start_date. | date | (/) |null |  |  ||targeting_types |Targeting type breakdowns for the report. The reporting per targeting type &lt;br&gt; is independent from each other. [&quot;AGE_BUCKET_AND_GENDER&quot;\] is in BETA and not yet available to all users. | array[AdsAnalyticsTargetingType] | (/) |null |  |  ||columns |Columns to retrieve, encoded as a comma-separated string. **NOTE**: Any metrics defined as MICRO_DOLLARS returns a value based on the advertiser profile&#39;s currency field. For USD,($1/1,000,000, or $0.000001 - one one-ten-thousandth of a cent). it&#39;s microdollars. Otherwise, it&#39;s in microunits of the advertiser&#39;s currency.&lt;br/&gt;For example, if the advertiser&#39;s currency is GBP (British pound sterling), all MICRO_DOLLARS fields will be in GBP microunits (1/1,000,000 British pound).&lt;br/&gt;If a column has no value, it may not be returned | array[String] | (/) |null |  |  ||granularity |TOTAL - metrics are aggregated over the specified date range.&lt;br&gt; DAY - metrics are broken down daily.&lt;br&gt; HOUR - metrics are broken down hourly.&lt;br&gt;WEEKLY - metrics are broken down weekly.&lt;br&gt;MONTHLY - metrics are broken down monthly | Granularity | (/) |null |  |  ||click_window_days |Number of days to use as the conversion attribution window for a pin click action. Applies to Pinterest Tag conversion metrics. Prior conversion tags use their defined attribution windows. If not specified, defaults to &#x60;30&#x60; days. | Integer | (x) |30 |  | [0, 1, 7, 14, 30, 60] ||engagement_window_days |Number of days to use as the conversion attribution window for an engagement action. Engagements include saves, closeups, link clicks, and carousel card swipes. Applies to Pinterest Tag conversion metrics. Prior conversion tags use their defined attribution windows. If not specified, defaults to &#x60;30&#x60; days. | Integer | (x) |30 |  | [0, 1, 7, 14, 30, 60] ||view_window_days |Number of days to use as the conversion attribution window for a view action. Applies to Pinterest Tag conversion metrics. Prior conversion tags use their defined attribution windows. If not specified, defaults to &#x60;1&#x60; day. | Integer | (x) |1 |  | [0, 1, 7, 14, 30, 60] ||conversion_report_time |The date by which the conversion metrics returned from this endpoint will be reported. There are two dates associated with a conversion event: the date that the user interacted with the ad, and the date that the user completed a conversion event. | String | (x) |TIME_OF_AD_ACTION |  | [TIME_OF_AD_ACTION, TIME_OF_CONVERSION] ||attribution_types |List of types of attribution for the conversion report | ConversionReportAttributionType | (x) |null |  |  |
----
h4. Responses

    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Green|title=200|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Success |
    	|| Response Type | MetricsResponse |
    	|| Response Model | [MetricsResponse Model|#MetricsResponseModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "Success",
  "content" : {
    "application/json" : {
      "schema" : {
        "$ref" : "#/components/schemas/MetricsResponse"
      }
    }
  }
}{code} |
       


    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Red|title=0|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Unexpected error |
    	|| Response Type | Error |
    	|| Response Model | [Error Model|#ErrorModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "Unexpected error",
  "content" : {
    "application/json" : {
      "schema" : {
        "$ref" : "#/components/schemas/Error"
      }
    }
  }
}{code} |
       

{panel}



h3. adAccounts/create
{panel:title=adAccounts/create|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Create ad account
    *Description:* Create a new ad account. Different ad accounts can support different currencies, payment methods, etc.
An ad account is needed to create campaigns, ad groups, and ads; other accounts (your employees or partners) can be assigned business access and appropriate roles to access an ad account. &lt;p/&gt;
You can set up up to 50 ad accounts per user. (The user must have a business account to create an ad account.) &lt;p/&gt;
For more, see &lt;a class&#x3D;&quot;reference external&quot; href&#x3D;&quot;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/create-an-advertiser-account&quot;&gt;Create an advertiser account&lt;/a&gt;.

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=post|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/ad_accounts{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |
----
h4. Parameters

h5. Body Parameter
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |AdAccountCreateRequest |Ad account to create. | AdAccountCreateRequest | (/) | |  |  |


----
h4. Responses

    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Green|title=200|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Success |
    	|| Response Type | AdAccount |
    	|| Response Model | [AdAccount Model|#AdAccountModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "Success",
  "content" : {
    "application/json" : {
      "schema" : {
        "$ref" : "#/components/schemas/AdAccount"
      }
    }
  }
}{code} |
       


    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Red|title=0|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Unexpected error |
    	|| Response Type | Error |
    	|| Response Model | [Error Model|#ErrorModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "Unexpected error",
  "content" : {
    "application/json" : {
      "schema" : {
        "$ref" : "#/components/schemas/Error"
      }
    }
  }
}{code} |
       

{panel}

h3. adAccounts/list
{panel:title=adAccounts/list|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* List ad accounts
    *Description:* Get a list of the ad_accounts that the &quot;operation user_account&quot; has access to.
- This includes ad_accounts they own and ad_accounts that are owned by others who have granted them &lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/share-and-manage-access-to-your-ad-accounts&quot;&gt;Business Access&lt;/a&gt;.

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=get|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/ad_accounts{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |
----
h4. Parameters



h5. Query Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |bookmark |Cursor used to fetch the next page of items | String | (x) |null |  |  ||page_size |Maximum number of items to include in a single page of the response. See documentation on &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/reference/pagination/&#39;&gt;Pagination&lt;/a&gt; for more information. | Integer | (x) |25 |  |  ||include_shared_accounts |Include shared ad accounts | Boolean | (x) |true |  |  |
----
h4. Responses

    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Green|title=200|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | response |
    	|| Response Type | ad_accounts_list_200_response |
    	|| Response Model | [ad_accounts_list_200_response Model|#ad_accounts_list_200_responseModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "response",
  "content" : {
    "application/json" : {
      "schema" : {
        "$ref" : "#/components/schemas/ad_accounts_list_200_response"
      }
    }
  }
}{code} |
       


    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Red|title=0|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Unexpected error |
    	|| Response Type | Error |
    	|| Response Model | [Error Model|#ErrorModelAnchor|Jump to model] |

h3. analytics/createMmmReport
{panel:title=analytics/createMmmReport|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Create a request for a Marketing Mix Modeling (MMM) report
    *Description:* This creates an asynchronous mmm report based on the given request. It returns a token that you can use to download
the report when it is ready. NOTE: An additional limit of 5 queries per minute per advertiser applies to this endpoint while it&#39;s in beta release.

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=post|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/ad_accounts/{ad_account_id}/mmm_reports{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |
----
h4. Parameters
h5. Path Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |ad_account_id |Unique identifier of an ad account. | String | (/) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  |

h5. Body Parameter
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |CreateMMMReportRequest | | CreateMMMReportRequest | (/) | |  |  |


----
h4. Responses

    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Green|title=200|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Success |
    	|| Response Type | CreateMMMReportResponse |
    	|| Response Model | [CreateMMMReportResponse Model|#CreateMMMReportResponseModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "Success",
  "content" : {
    "application/json" : {
      "schema" : {
        "$ref" : "#/components/schemas/CreateMMMReportResponse"
      }
    }
  }
}{code} |
       


    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Orange|title=400|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Invalid ad account ads analytics mmm parameters |
    	|| Response Type | Error |
    	|| Response Model | [Error Model|#ErrorModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "Invalid ad account ads analytics mmm parameters",
  "content" : {
    "application/json" : {
      "schema" : {
        "$ref" : "#/components/schemas/Error"
      },
      "example" : {
        "code" : 400,
        "message" : "Invalid ad account ads analytics mmm parameters"
      }
    }
  }
}{code} |
       


    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Red|title=0|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Unexpected error |
    	|| Response Type | Error |

{panel}



h3. analytics/createReport
{panel:title=analytics/createReport|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Create async request for an account analytics report
    *Description:* This returns a token that you can use to download the report when it is ready. Note that this endpoint requires the parameters to be passed as JSON-formatted in the request body. This endpoint does not support URL query parameters.
- The token&#39;s user_account must either be the Owner of the specified ad account, or have one of the necessary roles granted to them via &lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/share-and-manage-access-to-your-ad-accounts&quot;&gt;Business Access&lt;/a&gt;: Admin, Analyst, Campaign Manager.
- If granularity is not HOUR, the furthest back you can are allowed to pull data is 914 days before the current date in UTC time and the max time range supported is 186 days.
- If granularity is HOUR, the furthest back you can are allowed to pull data is 8 days before the current date in UTC time and the max time range supported is 3 days.
- If level is PRODUCT_ITEM, the furthest back you can are allowed to pull data is 92 days before the current date in UTC time and the max time range supported is 31 days.
- If level is PRODUCT_ITEM, ad_ids and ad_statuses parameters are not allowed. Any columns related to pin promotion and ad is not allowed either.

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=post|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/ad_accounts/{ad_account_id}/reports{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |
----
h4. Parameters
h5. Path Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |ad_account_id |Unique identifier of an ad account. | String | (/) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  |

h5. Body Parameter
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |AdsAnalyticsCreateAsyncRequest | | AdsAnalyticsCreateAsyncRequest | (/) | |  |  |


----
h4. Responses

    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Green|title=200|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Success |
    	|| Response Type | AdsAnalyticsCreateAsyncResponse |
    	|| Response Model | [AdsAnalyticsCreateAsyncResponse Model|#AdsAnalyticsCreateAsyncResponseModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "Success",
  "content" : {
    "application/json" : {
      "schema" : {
        "$ref" : "#/components/schemas/AdsAnalyticsCreateAsyncResponse"
      }
    }
  }
}{code} |
       


    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Orange|title=400|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Invalid ad account ads analytics parameters. |
    	|| Response Type | Error |
    	|| Response Model | [Error Model|#ErrorModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "Invalid ad account ads analytics parameters.",
  "content" : {
    "application/json" : {
      "schema" : {
        "$ref" : "#/components/schemas/Error"
      },
      "example" : {
        "code" : 400,
        "message" : "Invalid ad account ads analytics parameters."
      }
    }
  }
}{code} |
       


    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Red|title=0|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Unexpected error |
    	|| Response Type | Error |
    	|| Response Model | [Error Model|#ErrorModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "Unexpected error",
  "content" : {
    "application/json" : {
      "schema" : {
        "$ref" : "#/components/schemas/Error"
      }
    }
  }
}{code} |

h3. analytics/createTemplateReport
{panel:title=analytics/createTemplateReport|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Create async request for an analytics report using a template
    *Description:* This takes a template ID and an optional custom timeframe and constructs an asynchronous report based on the
template. It returns a token that you can use to download the report when it is ready.

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=post|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/ad_accounts/{ad_account_id}/templates/{template_id}/reports{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |
----
h4. Parameters
h5. Path Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |ad_account_id |Unique identifier of an ad account. | String | (/) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  ||template_id |Unique identifier of a template. | String | (/) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  |



h5. Query Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |start_date |Metric report start date (UTC). Format: YYYY-MM-DD. Cannot be more than 2.5 years back from today. | date | (x) |null |  |  ||end_date |Metric report end date (UTC). Format: YYYY-MM-DD. Cannot be more than 2.5 years past start date. | date | (x) |null |  |  ||granularity |TOTAL - metrics are aggregated over the specified date range.&lt;br&gt; DAY - metrics are broken down daily.&lt;br&gt; HOUR - metrics are broken down hourly.&lt;br&gt;WEEKLY - metrics are broken down weekly.&lt;br&gt;MONTHLY - metrics are broken down monthly | Granularity | (x) |null |  |  |
----
h4. Responses

    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Green|title=200|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Success |
    	|| Response Type | AdsAnalyticsCreateAsyncResponse |
    	|| Response Model | [AdsAnalyticsCreateAsyncResponse Model|#AdsAnalyticsCreateAsyncResponseModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "Success",
  "content" : {
    "application/json" : {
      "schema" : {
        "$ref" : "#/components/schemas/AdsAnalyticsCreateAsyncResponse"
      }
    }
  }
}{code} |
       


    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Orange|title=400|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Invalid ad account ads analytics template parameters. |
    	|| Response Type | Error |
    	|| Response Model | [Error Model|#ErrorModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "Invalid ad account ads analytics template parameters.",
  "content" : {
    "application/json" : {
      "schema" : {
        "$ref" : "#/components/schemas/Error"
      },
      "example" : {
        "code" : 400,
        "message" : "Invalid ad account analytics template parameters."
      }
    }
  }
}{code} |
       


    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Red|title=0|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Unexpected error |
    	|| Response Type | Error |
    	|| Response Model | [Error Model|#ErrorModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "Unexpected error",
  "content" : {
    "application/json" : {
      "schema" : {
        "$ref" : "#/components/schemas/Error"
      }
    }
  }
}{code} |

h3. analytics/getMmmReport
{panel:title=analytics/getMmmReport|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Get advertiser Marketing Mix Modeling (MMM) report.
    *Description:* Get an mmm report for an ad account. This returns a URL to an mmm metrics report given a token returned from the
create mmm report endpoint.

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=get|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/ad_accounts/{ad_account_id}/mmm_reports{noformat} |

        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||

        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||

h3. analytics/getReport
{panel:title=analytics/getReport|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Get the account analytics report created by the async call
    *Description:* This returns a URL to an analytics report given a token returned from the post request report creation call. You can use the URL to download the report. The link is valid for five minutes and the report is valid for one hour.
- The token&#39;s user_account must either be the Owner of the specified ad account, or have one of the necessary roles granted to them via &lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/share-and-manage-access-to-your-ad-accounts&quot;&gt;Business Access&lt;/a&gt;: Admin, Analyst, Campaign Manager.

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=get|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/ad_accounts/{ad_account_id}/reports{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |
----
h4. Parameters
h5. Path Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |ad_account_id |Unique identifier of an ad account. | String | (/) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  |



h5. Query Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |token |Token returned from the post request creation call | String | (/) |null |  |  |
----
h4. Responses

    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Green|title=200|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Success |
    	|| Response Type | AdsAnalyticsGetAsyncResponse |
    	|| Response Model | [AdsAnalyticsGetAsyncResponse Model|#AdsAnalyticsGetAsyncResponseModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "Success",
  "content" : {
    "application/json" : {
      "schema" : {
        "$ref" : "#/components/schemas/AdsAnalyticsGetAsyncResponse"
      }
    }
  }
}{code} |
       


    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Orange|title=400|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Invalid ad account ads analytics parameters. |
    	|| Response Type | Error |
    	|| Response Model | [Error Model|#ErrorModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "Invalid ad account ads analytics parameters.",
  "content" : {

      "schema" : {
        "$ref" : "#/components/schemas/Error"
      },
      "example" : {
        "code" : 400,
        "message" : "Invalid ad account ads analytics parameters."
      }
    }
  }

h3. sandbox/delete
{panel:title=sandbox/delete|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Delete ads data for ad account in API Sandbox
    *Description:* Delete an ad account and all the ads data associated with that account.
A string message is returned indicating the status of the delete operation.

Note: This endpoint is only allowed in the Pinterest API Sandbox (https://api-sandbox.pinterest.com/v5).
Go to /docs/developer-tools/sandbox/ for more information.

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=delete|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/ad_accounts/{ad_account_id}/sandbox{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |
----
h4. Parameters
h5. Path Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |ad_account_id |Unique identifier of an ad account. | String | (/) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  |



----
h4. Responses

    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Green|title=200|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | OK |
    	|| Response Type | String |
    	|| Response Model | [String Model|#StringModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "OK",
  "content" : {
    "application/json" : {
      "schema" : {
        "type" : "string",
        "example" : "Delete Success"
      }
    }
  }
}{code} |
       


    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Orange|title=400|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Invalid ad account id. |
    	|| Response Type | Error |
    	|| Response Model | [Error Model|#ErrorModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "Invalid ad account id.",
  "content" : {
    "application/json" : {
      "schema" : {
        "$ref" : "#/components/schemas/Error"
      },
      "example" : {
        "code" : 400,
        "message" : "Invalid ad account id"
      }
    }
  }
}{code} |
       


    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Red|title=0|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Unexpected error |
    	|| Response Type | Error |

by ID. Note that higher-value IDs are associated with more-recently added
items. | String | (x) |null |  | [ASCENDING, DESCENDING] ||bookmark |Cursor used to fetch the next page of items | String | (x) |null |  |  |

h3. adGroups/analytics
{panel:title=adGroups/analytics|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Get ad group analytics
    *Description:* Get analytics for the specified ad groups in the specified &lt;code&gt;ad_account_id&lt;/code&gt;, filtered by the specified options.
- The token&#39;s user_account must either be the Owner of the specified ad account, or have one of the necessary roles granted to them via &lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/share-and-manage-access-to-your-ad-accounts&quot;&gt;Business Access&lt;/a&gt;: Admin, Analyst, Campaign Manager.
- If granularity is not HOUR, the furthest back you can are allowed to pull data is 90 days before the current date in UTC time and the max time range supported is 90 days.
- If granularity is HOUR, the furthest back you can are allowed to pull data is 8 days before the current date in UTC time and the max time range supported is 3 days.

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=get|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/ad_accounts/{ad_account_id}/ad_groups/analytics{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |
----
h4. Parameters
h5. Path Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |ad_account_id |Unique identifier of an ad account. | String | (/) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  |



h5. Query Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |start_date |Metric report start date (UTC). Format: YYYY-MM-DD. Cannot be more than 90 days back from today. | date | (/) |null |  |  ||end_date |Metric report end date (UTC). Format: YYYY-MM-DD. Cannot be more than 90 days past start_date. | date | (/) |null |  |  ||ad_group_ids |List of Ad group Ids to use to filter the results. | array[String] | (/) |null |  |  ||columns |Columns to retrieve, encoded as a comma-separated string. **NOTE**: Any metrics defined as MICRO_DOLLARS returns a value based on the advertiser profile&#39;s currency field. For USD,($1/1,000,000, or $0.000001 - one one-ten-thousandth of a cent). it&#39;s microdollars. Otherwise, it&#39;s in microunits of the advertiser&#39;s currency.&lt;br/&gt;For example, if the advertiser&#39;s currency is GBP (British pound sterling), all MICRO_DOLLARS fields will be in GBP microunits (1/1,000,000 British pound).&lt;br/&gt;If a column has no value, it may not be returned | array[String] | (/) |null |  |  ||granularity |TOTAL - metrics are aggregated over the specified date range.&lt;br&gt; DAY - metrics are broken down daily.&lt;br&gt; HOUR - metrics are broken down hourly.&lt;br&gt;WEEKLY - metrics are broken down weekly.&lt;br&gt;MONTHLY - metrics are broken down monthly | Granularity | (/) |null |  |  ||click_window_days |Number of days to use as the conversion attribution window for a pin click action. Applies to Pinterest Tag conversion metrics. Prior conversion tags use their defined attribution windows. If not specified, defaults to &#x60;30&#x60; days. | Integer | (x) |30 |  | [0, 1, 7, 14, 30, 60] ||engagement_window_days |Number of days to use as the conversion attribution window for an engagement action. Engagements include saves, closeups, link clicks, and carousel card swipes. Applies to Pinterest Tag conversion metrics. Prior conversion tags use their defined attribution windows. If not specified, defaults to &#x60;30&#x60; days. | Integer | (x) |30 |  | [0, 1, 7, 14, 30, 60] ||view_window_days |Number of days to use as the conversion attribution window for a view action. Applies to Pinterest Tag conversion metrics. Prior conversion tags use their defined attribution windows. If not specified, defaults to &#x60;1&#x60; day. | Integer | (x) |1 |  | [0, 1, 7, 14, 30, 60] ||conversion_report_time |The date by which the conversion metrics returned from this endpoint will be reported. There are two dates associated with a conversion event: the date that the user interacted with the ad, and the date that the user completed a conversion event. | String | (x) |TIME_OF_AD_ACTION |  | [TIME_OF_AD_ACTION, TIME_OF_CONVERSION] |
----
h4. Responses

    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Green|title=200|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Success |
    	|| Response Type | array[AdGroupsAnalyticsResponse_inner] |
    	|| Response Model | [array[AdGroupsAnalyticsResponse_inner] Model|#array[AdGroupsAnalyticsResponse_inner]ModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "Success",
  "content" : {
    "application/json" : {
      "schema" : {
        "$ref" : "#/components/schemas/AdGroupsAnalyticsResponse"
      }
    }
  }
}{code} |
       


    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Orange|title=400|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Invalid ad account group analytics parameters. |
    	|| Response Type | Error |
    	|| Response Model | [Error Model|#ErrorModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "Invalid ad account group analytics parameters.",
  "content" : {
    "application/json" : {
      "schema" : {
        "$ref" : "#/components/schemas/Error"
      },
      "example" : {
        "code" : 400,
        "message" : "Invalid ad account group analytics parameters."
      }
    }
  }
}{code} |
       


    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Red|title=0|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Unexpected error |
    	|| Response Type | Error |

h3. adGroups/audienceSizing
{panel:title=adGroups/audienceSizing|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Get audience sizing
    *Description:* Get potential audience size for an ad group with given targeting criteria. 
Potential audience size estimates the number of people you may be able to reach per month with your campaign. 
It is based on historical advertising data and the targeting criteria you select.
It does not guarantee results or take into account factors such as bid, budget, schedule, seasonality or product experiments.

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=post|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/ad_accounts/{ad_account_id}/ad_groups/audience_sizing{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |
----
h4. Parameters
h5. Path Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |ad_account_id |Unique identifier of an ad account. | String | (/) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  |

h5. Body Parameter
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |AdGroupAudienceSizingRequest | | AdGroupAudienceSizingRequest | (x) | |  |  |


----
h4. Responses

    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Green|title=200|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Success |
    	|| Response Type | AdGroupAudienceSizingResponse |

  "description" : "Invalid ad group audience sizing parameters.",
  "content" : {
    "application/json" : {
      "schema" : {
        "$ref" : "#/components/schemas/Error"
      },
      "example" : {
        "code" : 400,
        "message" : "Invalid ad group audience sizing parameters."
      }
    }
  }
}{code} |
       


    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Orange|title=403|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | No access to requested audience list or product group. |
    	|| Response Type | Error |
    	|| Response Model | [Error Model|#ErrorModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "No access to requested audience list or product group.",

        "$ref" : "#/components/schemas/Error"
      },
      "example" : {
        "code" : 403,
        "message" : "You don't have access to the requested audience list or product group."
      }
    }
  }
}{code} |

h3. adGroups/create
{panel:title=adGroups/create|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Create ad groups
    *Description:* Create multiple new ad groups. All ads in a given ad group will have the same budget, bid, run dates, targeting, and placement (search, browse, other). For more information, &lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/campaign-structure&quot; target&#x3D;&quot;_blank&quot;&gt; click here&lt;/a&gt;.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;strong&gt;Note:&lt;/strong&gt;
- &#39;bid_in_micro_currency&#39; and &#39;budget_in_micro_currency&#39; should be expressed in microcurrency amounts based on the currency field set in the advertiser&#39;s profile.&lt;p/&gt;
&lt;p&gt;Microcurrency is used to track very small transactions, based on the currency set in the advertiser’s profile.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;A microcurrency unit is 10^(-6) of the standard unit of currency selected in the advertiser’s profile.&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Equivalency equations&lt;/strong&gt;, using dollars as an example currency:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;ul&gt;
  &lt;li&gt;$1 &#x3D; 1,000,000 microdollars&lt;/li&gt;
  &lt;li&gt;1 microdollar &#x3D; $0.000001 &lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;
&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;To convert between currency and microcurrency&lt;/strong&gt;, using dollars as an example currency:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;ul&gt;
  &lt;li&gt;To convert dollars to microdollars, mutiply dollars by 1,000,000&lt;/li&gt;
  &lt;li&gt;To convert microdollars to dollars, divide microdollars by 1,000,000&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;
- Ad groups belong to ad campaigns. Some types of campaigns (e.g. budget optimization) have limits on the number of ad groups they can hold. If you exceed those limits, you will get an error message.
- Start and end time cannot be set for ad groups that belong to CBO campaigns. Currently, campaigns with the following objective types: TRAFFIC, AWARENESS, WEB_CONVERSIONS, and CATALOG_SALES will default to CBO.

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=post|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/ad_accounts/{ad_account_id}/ad_groups{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |
----
h4. Parameters
h5. Path Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |ad_account_id |Unique identifier of an ad account. | String | (/) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  |

h5. Body Parameter
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |AdGroupCreateRequest |List of ad groups to create, size limit [1, 30\]. | array[AdGroupCreateRequest] | (/) | |  |  |


----
h4. Responses

    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Green|title=200|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Success |
    	|| Response Type | AdGroupArrayResponse |
    	|| Response Model | [AdGroupArrayResponse Model|#AdGroupArrayResponseModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "Success",
  "content" : {
    "application/json" : {
      "schema" : {
        "$ref" : "#/components/schemas/AdGroupArrayResponse"
      }
    }
  }
}{code} |
       


    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Red|title=0|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Unexpected error |
    	|| Response Type | Error |
    	|| Response Model | [Error Model|#ErrorModelAnchor|Jump to model] |

  "description" : "Unexpected error",
  "content" : {
    "application/json" : {
      "schema" : {
        "$ref" : "#/components/schemas/Error"

    }
  }

contain additional information from the Ad Review process.
For more information about our policies and rejection reasons see the &lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;https://www.pinterest.com/_/_/policy/advertising-guidelines/&quot; target&#x3D;&quot;_blank&quot;&gt;Pinterest advertising standards&lt;/a&gt;.

    *Description:* List ad groups based on provided campaign IDs or ad group IDs.(campaign_ids or ad_group_ids). &lt;p/&gt;
&lt;strong&gt;Note:&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;p/&gt;
Provide only campaign_id or ad_group_id. Do not provide both.

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=get|subtle=false} |

by ID. Note that higher-value IDs are associated with more-recently added
items. | String | (x) |null |  | [ASCENDING, DESCENDING] ||bookmark |Cursor used to fetch the next page of items | String | (x) |null |  |  ||translate_interests_to_names |Return interests as text names (if value is true) rather than topic IDs. | Boolean | (x) |false |  |  |

h3. adGroupsBidFloor/get
{panel:title=adGroupsBidFloor/get|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Get bid floors
    *Description:* List bid floors for your campaign configuration. Bid floors are given in microcurrency values based on the currency in the bid floor specification. &lt;p/&gt;
&lt;p&gt;Microcurrency is used to track very small transactions, based on the currency set in the advertiser’s profile.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;A microcurrency unit is 10^(-6) of the standard unit of currency selected in the advertiser’ s profile.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Equivalency equations&lt;/strong&gt;, using dollars as an example currency:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;ul&gt;
  &lt;li&gt;$1 &#x3D; 1,000,000 microdollars&lt;/li&gt;
  &lt;li&gt;1 microdollar &#x3D; $0.000001 &lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;
&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;To convert between currency and microcurrency&lt;/strong&gt;, using dollars as an example currency:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;ul&gt;
  &lt;li&gt;To convert dollars to microdollars, mutiply dollars by 1,000,000&lt;/li&gt;
  &lt;li&gt;To convert microdollars to dollars, divide microdollars by 1,000,000&lt;/li&gt;
 &lt;/ul&gt;
For more on bid floors see &lt;a class&#x3D;&quot;reference external&quot; href&#x3D;&quot;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/set-your-bid&quot;&gt; Set your bid&lt;/a&gt;.

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=post|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/ad_accounts/{ad_account_id}/bid_floor{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |
----
h4. Parameters
h5. Path Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |ad_account_id |Unique identifier of an ad account. | String | (/) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  |

h5. Body Parameter

        |BidFloorRequest |Parameters to get bid_floor info | BidFloorRequest | (/) | |  |  |

h3. adGroupsTargetingAnalytics/get
{panel:title=adGroupsTargetingAnalytics/get|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Get targeting analytics for ad groups
    *Description:* Get targeting analytics for one or more ad groups.
For the requested ad group(s) and metrics, the response will include the requested metric information
(e.g. SPEND_IN_DOLLAR) for the requested target type (e.g. &quot;age_bucket&quot;) for applicable values (e.g. &quot;45-49&quot;). &lt;p/&gt;
- The token&#39;s user_account must either be the Owner of the specified ad account, or have one
of the necessary roles granted to them via
&lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/share-and-manage-access-to-your-ad-accounts&quot;&gt;Business Access&lt;/a&gt;: Admin, Analyst, Campaign Manager.
- If granularity is not HOUR, the furthest back you can are allowed to pull data is 90 days before the current date in UTC time and the max time range supported is 90 days.
- If granularity is HOUR, the furthest back you can are allowed to pull data is 8 days before the current date in UTC time and the max time range supported is 3 days.

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=get|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/ad_accounts/{ad_account_id}/ad_groups/targeting_analytics{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |
----
h4. Parameters
h5. Path Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |ad_account_id |Unique identifier of an ad account. | String | (/) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  |



h5. Query Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |ad_group_ids |List of Ad group Ids to use to filter the results. | array[String] | (/) |null |  |  ||start_date |Metric report start date (UTC). Format: YYYY-MM-DD. Cannot be more than 90 days back from today. | date | (/) |null |  |  ||end_date |Metric report end date (UTC). Format: YYYY-MM-DD. Cannot be more than 90 days past start_date. | date | (/) |null |  |  ||targeting_types |Targeting type breakdowns for the report. The reporting per targeting type &lt;br&gt; is independent from each other. [&quot;AGE_BUCKET_AND_GENDER&quot;\] is in BETA and not yet available to all users. | array[AdsAnalyticsTargetingType] | (/) |null |  |  ||columns |Columns to retrieve, encoded as a comma-separated string. **NOTE**: Any metrics defined as MICRO_DOLLARS returns a value based on the advertiser profile&#39;s currency field. For USD,($1/1,000,000, or $0.000001 - one one-ten-thousandth of a cent). it&#39;s microdollars. Otherwise, it&#39;s in microunits of the advertiser&#39;s currency.&lt;br/&gt;For example, if the advertiser&#39;s currency is GBP (British pound sterling), all MICRO_DOLLARS fields will be in GBP microunits (1/1,000,000 British pound).&lt;br/&gt;If a column has no value, it may not be returned | array[String] | (/) |null |  |  ||granularity |TOTAL - metrics are aggregated over the specified date range.&lt;br&gt; DAY - metrics are broken down daily.&lt;br&gt; HOUR - metrics are broken down hourly.&lt;br&gt;WEEKLY - metrics are broken down weekly.&lt;br&gt;MONTHLY - metrics are broken down monthly | Granularity | (/) |null |  |  ||click_window_days |Number of days to use as the conversion attribution window for a pin click action. Applies to Pinterest Tag conversion metrics. Prior conversion tags use their defined attribution windows. If not specified, defaults to &#x60;30&#x60; days. | Integer | (x) |30 |  | [0, 1, 7, 14, 30, 60] ||engagement_window_days |Number of days to use as the conversion attribution window for an engagement action. Engagements include saves, closeups, link clicks, and carousel card swipes. Applies to Pinterest Tag conversion metrics. Prior conversion tags use their defined attribution windows. If not specified, defaults to &#x60;30&#x60; days. | Integer | (x) |30 |  | [0, 1, 7, 14, 30, 60] ||view_window_days |Number of days to use as the conversion attribution window for a view action. Applies to Pinterest Tag conversion metrics. Prior conversion tags use their defined attribution windows. If not specified, defaults to &#x60;1&#x60; day. | Integer | (x) |1 |  | [0, 1, 7, 14, 30, 60] ||conversion_report_time |The date by which the conversion metrics returned from this endpoint will be reported. There are two dates associated with a conversion event: the date that the user interacted with the ad, and the date that the user completed a conversion event. | String | (x) |TIME_OF_AD_ACTION |  | [TIME_OF_AD_ACTION, TIME_OF_CONVERSION] ||attribution_types |List of types of attribution for the conversion report | ConversionReportAttributionType | (x) |null |  |  |
----

h3. adPreviews/create
{panel:title=adPreviews/create|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Create ad preview with pin or image
    *Description:* Create an ad preview given an ad account ID and either an existing organic pin ID or the URL for an image to be used to create the Pin and the ad. &lt;p/&gt;
If you are creating a preview from an existing Pin, that Pin must be promotable: that is, it must have a clickthrough link and meet other requirements. (See &lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/promoted-pins-overview&quot; target&#x3D;&quot;_blank&quot;&gt;Ads Overview&lt;/a&gt;.) &lt;p/&gt;
You can view the returned preview URL on a webpage or iframe for 7 days, after which the URL expires. Collection ads are not currently supported ad preview.

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=post|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/ad_accounts/{ad_account_id}/ad_previews{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |
----
h4. Parameters
h5. Path Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |ad_account_id |Unique identifier of an ad account. | String | (/) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  |

h5. Body Parameter
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |AdPreviewRequest |Create ad preview with pin or image. | AdPreviewRequest | (/) | |  |  |


----
h4. Responses

    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Green|title=200|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Successful ad preview creation. |
    	|| Response Type | AdPreviewURLResponse |

      "schema" : {
        "$ref" : "#/components/schemas/AdPreviewURLResponse"
      }
    }
  }
}{code} |
       


    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Orange|title=400|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Invalid Pin parameters response |
    	|| Response Type | Error |
    	|| Response Model | [Error Model|#ErrorModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "Invalid Pin parameters response",
  "content" : {
    "application/json" : {
      "schema" : {
        "$ref" : "#/components/schemas/Error"
      },
      "examples" : {
        "InvalidPinUrl" : {
          "value" : {
            "code" : 1,
            "message" : "Whoops! It looks like you entered an invalid URL. Try creating a Pin again with a valid URL."
          }
        }
      }
    }
  }
}{code} |

h3. adTargetingAnalytics/get
{panel:title=adTargetingAnalytics/get|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Get targeting analytics for ads
    *Description:* Get targeting analytics for one or more ads. For the requested ad(s) and metrics,
the response will include the requested metric information (e.g. SPEND_IN_DOLLAR) for the requested target type
(e.g. &quot;age_bucket&quot;) for applicable values (e.g. &quot;45-49&quot;). &lt;p/&gt;
- The token&#39;s user_account must either be the Owner of the specified ad account, or have one
of the necessary roles granted to them via
&lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/share-and-manage-access-to-your-ad-accounts&quot;&gt;Business Access&lt;/a&gt;: Admin, Analyst, Campaign Manager.
- If granularity is not HOUR, the furthest back you can are allowed to pull data is 90 days before the current date in UTC time and the max time range supported is 90 days.
- If granularity is HOUR, the furthest back you can are allowed to pull data is 8 days before the current date in UTC time and the max time range supported is 3 days.

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=get|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/ad_accounts/{ad_account_id}/ads/targeting_analytics{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |
----
h4. Parameters
h5. Path Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |ad_account_id |Unique identifier of an ad account. | String | (/) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  |



h5. Query Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |ad_ids |List of Ad Ids to use to filter the results. | array[String] | (/) |null |  |  ||start_date |Metric report start date (UTC). Format: YYYY-MM-DD. Cannot be more than 90 days back from today. | date | (/) |null |  |  ||end_date |Metric report end date (UTC). Format: YYYY-MM-DD. Cannot be more than 90 days past start_date. | date | (/) |null |  |  ||targeting_types |Targeting type breakdowns for the report. The reporting per targeting type &lt;br&gt; is independent from each other. [&quot;AGE_BUCKET_AND_GENDER&quot;\] is in BETA and not yet available to all users. | array[AdsAnalyticsAdTargetingType] | (/) |null |  |  ||columns |Columns to retrieve, encoded as a comma-separated string. **NOTE**: Any metrics defined as MICRO_DOLLARS returns a value based on the advertiser profile&#39;s currency field. For USD,($1/1,000,000, or $0.000001 - one one-ten-thousandth of a cent). it&#39;s microdollars. Otherwise, it&#39;s in microunits of the advertiser&#39;s currency.&lt;br/&gt;For example, if the advertiser&#39;s currency is GBP (British pound sterling), all MICRO_DOLLARS fields will be in GBP microunits (1/1,000,000 British pound).&lt;br/&gt;If a column has no value, it may not be returned | array[String] | (/) |null |  |  ||granularity |TOTAL - metrics are aggregated over the specified date range.&lt;br&gt; DAY - metrics are broken down daily.&lt;br&gt; HOUR - metrics are broken down hourly.&lt;br&gt;WEEKLY - metrics are broken down weekly.&lt;br&gt;MONTHLY - metrics are broken down monthly | Granularity | (/) |null |  |  ||click_window_days |Number of days to use as the conversion attribution window for a pin click action. Applies to Pinterest Tag conversion metrics. Prior conversion tags use their defined attribution windows. If not specified, defaults to &#x60;30&#x60; days. | Integer | (x) |30 |  | [0, 1, 7, 14, 30, 60] ||engagement_window_days |Number of days to use as the conversion attribution window for an engagement action. Engagements include saves, closeups, link clicks, and carousel card swipes. Applies to Pinterest Tag conversion metrics. Prior conversion tags use their defined attribution windows. If not specified, defaults to &#x60;30&#x60; days. | Integer | (x) |30 |  | [0, 1, 7, 14, 30, 60] ||view_window_days |Number of days to use as the conversion attribution window for a view action. Applies to Pinterest Tag conversion metrics. Prior conversion tags use their defined attribution windows. If not specified, defaults to &#x60;1&#x60; day. | Integer | (x) |1 |  | [0, 1, 7, 14, 30, 60] ||conversion_report_time |The date by which the conversion metrics returned from this endpoint will be reported. There are two dates associated with a conversion event: the date that the user interacted with the ad, and the date that the user completed a conversion event. | String | (x) |TIME_OF_AD_ACTION |  | [TIME_OF_AD_ACTION, TIME_OF_CONVERSION] ||attribution_types |List of types of attribution for the conversion report | ConversionReportAttributionType | (x) |null |  |  |
----

      }
    }
  }

h3. ads/analytics
{panel:title=ads/analytics|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Get ad analytics
    *Description:* Get analytics for the specified ads in the specified &lt;code&gt;ad_account_id&lt;/code&gt;, filtered by the specified options.
- The token&#39;s user_account must either be the Owner of the specified ad account, or have one of the necessary roles granted to them via &lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/share-and-manage-access-to-your-ad-accounts&quot;&gt;Business Access&lt;/a&gt;: Admin, Analyst, Campaign Manager.
- The request must contain either ad_ids or both campaign_ids and pin_ids.
- If granularity is not HOUR, the furthest back you can are allowed to pull data is 90 days before the current date in UTC time and the max time range supported is 90 days.
- If granularity is HOUR, the furthest back you can are allowed to pull data is 8 days before the current date in UTC time and the max time range supported is 3 days.

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=get|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/ad_accounts/{ad_account_id}/ads/analytics{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |
----

h5. Path Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |ad_account_id |Unique identifier of an ad account. | String | (/) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  |

For USD,($1/1,000,000, or $0.000001 - one one-ten-thousandth of a cent). it&#39;s microdollars. h3. ads/get

    *Summary:* Get ad
    *Description:* Get a specific ad given the ad ID. If your pin is rejected, rejected_reasons will
contain additional information from the Ad Review process.
For more information about our policies and rejection reasons see the &lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;https://www.pinterest.com/_/_/policy/advertising-guidelines/&quot; target&#x3D;&quot;_blank&quot;&gt;Pinterest advertising standards&lt;/a&gt;.

h3. ads/list
{panel:title=ads/list|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* List ads
    *Description:* List ads that meet the filters provided:
  - Listed campaign ids or ad group ids or ad ids
  - Listed entity statuses &lt;p/&gt;
If no filter is provided, all ads in the ad account are returned. &lt;p/&gt;
&lt;strong&gt;Note:&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;p/&gt;
Provide only campaign_id or ad_group_id or ad_id. Do not provide more than one type. &lt;p/&gt;
Review status is provided for each ad; if review_status is REJECTED, the rejected_reasons field will contain additional information.
For more, see &lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;https://policy.pinterest.com/en/advertising-guidelines&quot;&gt;Pinterest advertising standards&lt;/a&gt;.

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=get|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/ad_accounts/{ad_account_id}/ads{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |
----
h4. Parameters
h5. Path Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |ad_account_id |Unique identifier of an ad account. | String | (/) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  |



h5. Query Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |campaign_ids |List of Campaign Ids to use to filter the results. | array[String] | (x) |null |  |  ||ad_group_ids |List of Ad group Ids to use to filter the results. | array[String] | (x) |null |  |  ||ad_ids |List of Ad Ids to use to filter the results. | array[String] | (x) |null |  |  ||entity_statuses |Entity status | array[String] | (x) |[&quot;ACTIVE&quot;,&quot;PAUSED&quot;] |  |  ||page_size |Maximum number of items to include in a single page of the response. See documentation on &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/reference/pagination/&#39;&gt;Pagination&lt;/a&gt; for more information. | Integer | (x) |25 |  |  ||order |The order in which to sort the items returned: “ASCENDING” or “DESCENDING”
by ID. Note that higher-value IDs are associated with more-recently added
items. | String | (x) |null |  | [ASCENDING, DESCENDING] ||bookmark |Cursor used to fetch the next page of items | String | (x) |null |  |  |

h3. advancedAuctionItemsGet/post
{panel:title=advancedAuctionItemsGet/post|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Get item bid options (POST)
    *Description:* Get the bid options for a batch of retail catalog items.

The catalog must be owned by the &quot;operation user_account&quot;. &lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;/docs/api-features/shopping-overview/#Update%20items%20in%20batch&quot; target&#x3D;&quot;_blank&quot;&gt;See detailed documentation here.&lt;/a&gt; By default, the &quot;operation user_account&quot; is the token user_account.

Optional: Business Access: Specify an &lt;code&gt;ad_account_id&lt;/code&gt; (obtained via &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/api/v5/#operation/ad_accounts/list&#39;&gt;List ad accounts&lt;/a&gt;) to use the owner of that ad_account as the &quot;operation user_account&quot;. In order to do this, the token user_account must have one of the following &lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/share-and-manage-access-to-your-ad-accounts&quot;&gt;Business Access&lt;/a&gt; roles on the ad_account: &#x60;Owner&#x60;, &#x60;Admin&#x60;.

This endpoint is not available to all users.

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=post|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/advanced_auction/items/get{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |
----
h4. Parameters

h5. Body Parameter
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |AdvancedAuctionItemsGetRequest |Request object used to get bid options values for a batch of retail catalog items | AdvancedAuctionItemsGetRequest | (/) | |  |  |


h5. Query Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |ad_account_id |Unique identifier of an ad account. | String | (x) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  |
----
h4. Responses

    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Green|title=200|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Response containing the bid option values for the requested retail catalog items. Items that don&#39;t exist or do not have bid options set won&#39;t be present in the response. |
    	|| Response Type | AdvancedAuctionItems |
    	|| Response Model | [AdvancedAuctionItems Model|#AdvancedAuctionItemsModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "Response containing the bid option values for the requested retail catalog items. Items that don't exist or do not have bid options set won't be present in the response.",
  "content" : {
    "application/json" : {
      "schema" : {
        "$ref" : "#/components/schemas/AdvancedAuctionItems"
      }
    }
  }
}{code} |
       


    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Orange|title=400|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Invalid request parameters. |

h3. advancedAuctionItemsSubmit/post
{panel:title=advancedAuctionItemsSubmit/post|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Operate on item level bid options
    *Description:* This endpoint supports multiple operations on a set of one or more bid options (bid price and bid adjustments for targeting categories) for retail catalog items. These advanced auction settings are applied in campaigns using objective_type &#x60;CATALOG_SALES&#x60; and ad groups using bid_strategy_type &#x60;MAX_BID&#x60;.

The catalog must be owned by the &quot;operation user_account&quot;. &lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;/docs/api-features/modify-items-in-batch/&quot; target&#x3D;&quot;_blank&quot;&gt;See detailed documentation here.&lt;/a&gt; By default, the &quot;operation user_account&quot; is the token user_account.

Optional: Business Access: Specify an &lt;code&gt;ad_account_id&lt;/code&gt; (obtained via &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/api/v5/#operation/ad_accounts/list&#39;&gt;List ad accounts&lt;/a&gt;) to use the owner of that ad_account as the &quot;operation user_account&quot;. In order to do this, the token user_account must have one of the following &lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/share-and-manage-access-to-your-ad-accounts&quot;&gt;Business Access&lt;/a&gt; roles on the ad_account: &#x60;Owner&#x60;, &#x60;Admin&#x60;.

This endpoint is not available to all users.

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=post|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/advanced_auction/items/submit{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |
----
h4. Parameters

h5. Body Parameter
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |AdvancedAuctionItemsSubmitRequest |Request object used to upsert or delete bid options for a batch of retail catalog items | AdvancedAuctionItemsSubmitRequest | (/) | |  |  |


h5. Query Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |ad_account_id |Unique identifier of an ad account. | String | (x) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  |

h3. audienceInsights/get
{panel:title=audienceInsights/get|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Get audience insights
    *Description:* Get Audience Insights for an ad account. The response will return insights for 3 types of audiences: the
ad account&#39;s engaged audience on Pinterest, the ad account&#39;s total audience on Pinterest and Pinterest&#39;s
total audience.&lt;p/&gt;
&lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/audience-insights&quot; target&#x3D;&quot;_blank&quot;&gt;Learn more about Audience Insights&lt;/a&gt;.

h3. audienceInsightsScopeAndType/get
{panel:title=audienceInsightsScopeAndType/get|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Get audience insights scope and type
    *Description:* Get the scope and type of available audiences, which along with a date, is an audience that has recently had an interaction (referred to here as a type) on pins. Interacted pins can belong to at least the most common **partner** or **Pinterest** scopes. This means that user interactions made on advertiser or partner pins will have the **partner** scope. You can also have user interactions performed in general on Pinterest with the **Pinterest** scope. In that case, you can then use the returned type and scope values together on requests to other endpoints to retrieve insight metrics for a desired audience.

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=get|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/ad_accounts/{ad_account_id}/insights/audiences{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |
----
h4. Parameters
h5. Path Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |ad_account_id |Unique identifier of an ad account. | String | (/) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  |

    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Green|title=200|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Success |
    	|| Response Type | AudienceDefinitionResponse |
    	|| Response Model | [AudienceDefinitionResponse Model|#AudienceDefinitionResponseModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{

  "content" : {
    "application/json" : {
      "schema" : {
        "$ref" : "#/components/schemas/AudienceDefinitionResponse"
      }
    }
  }
}{code} |

h3. businessAccountAudiencesSharedAccounts/list
{panel:title=businessAccountAudiencesSharedAccounts/list|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* List accounts with access to an audience owned by a business
    *Description:* List all ad accounts and/or businesses that have access to a specific audience.
The audience must either be owned by an ad account in the requesting business, or it must have been shared with the requesting business.
If the requesting business is not the owner of the audience, only ad accounts owned by the requesting business will be returned.

h3. updateAdAccountToAdAccountSharedAudience
{panel:title=updateAdAccountToAdAccountSharedAudience|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Update audience sharing between ad accounts
    *Description:* From an ad account, share a specific audience with another ad account, or revoke access to a previously shared audience. Only the audience owner account can share the audience. The recipient ad account(s) must be in the same &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/create-and-manage-accounts&#39;&gt;Pinterest Business Hierarchy&lt;/a&gt; as the business owner of the ad account.&lt;br&gt; This endpoint is not available to all apps.&lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/getting-started/beta-and-advanced-access/&#39;&gt;Learn more&lt;/a&gt;.

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=patch|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/ad_accounts/{ad_account_id}/audiences/ad_accounts/shared{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |

h3. updateBusinessToAdAccountSharedAudience
{panel:title=updateBusinessToAdAccountSharedAudience|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Update audience sharing from a business to ad accounts
    *Description:* From a business, share a specific audience with other ad account(s), or revoke access to a previously shared audience. &lt;ul&gt; &lt;li&gt;If the business is the owner of the audience, it can share with any ad account within the same business hierarchy.&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;If the business is the recipient of the audience, it can share with any of its owned ad accounts.&lt;/li&gt; &lt;/ul&gt; This endpoint is not available to all apps.&lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/getting-started/beta-and-advanced-access/&#39;&gt;Learn more&lt;/a&gt;.

    *Summary:* Create audience
    *Description:* Create an audience you can use in targeting for specific ad groups. Targeting combines customer information with

For received audiences, it is sorted by sharing event time.
Note that higher-value IDs are associated with more-recently added items. | String | (x) |null |  | [ASCENDING, DESCENDING] ||page_size |Maximum number of items to include in a single page of the response. See documentation on &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/reference/pagination/&#39;&gt;Pagination&lt;/a&gt; for more information. | Integer | (x) |25 |  |  ||ownership_type |Filter audiences by ownership type. | String | (x) |OWNED |  | [OWNED, RECEIVED] |

h3. adsCredit/redeem
{panel:title=adsCredit/redeem|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Redeem ad credits
    *Description:* Redeem ads credit on behalf of the ad account id and apply it towards billing.

&lt;strong&gt;This endpoint might not be available to all apps. &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/getting-started/beta-and-advanced-access/&#39;&gt;Learn more&lt;/a&gt;.&lt;/strong&gt;

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=post|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/ad_accounts/{ad_account_id}/ads_credit/redeem{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |
----
h4. Parameters
h5. Path Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |ad_account_id |Unique identifier of an ad account. | String | (/) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  |

h5. Body Parameter
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |AdsCreditRedeemRequest |Redeem ad credits request. | AdsCreditRedeemRequest | (/) | |  |  |


----
h4. Responses

    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Green|title=200|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Successfully redeemed ad credits. |
    	|| Response Type | AdsCreditRedeemResponse |
    	|| Response Model | [AdsCreditRedeemResponse Model|#AdsCreditRedeemResponseModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "Successfully redeemed ad credits.",
  "content" : {
    "application/json" : {
      "schema" : {
        "$ref" : "#/components/schemas/AdsCreditRedeemResponse"
      }
    }
  }
}{code} |
       


    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Orange|title=400|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Error thrown when unable to redeem offer code. |
    	|| Response Type | Error |
    	|| Response Model | [Error Model|#ErrorModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "Error thrown when unable to redeem offer code.",
  "content" : {
    "application/json" : {
      "schema" : {
        "$ref" : "#/components/schemas/Error"
      },
      "examples" : {
        "ValidationError" : {
          "value" : {
            "code" : 15,
            "message" : "Unable to redeem offer code. Try again later."
          }
        }
      }
    }
  }
}{code} |
       


    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Red|title=0|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Unexpected error |
    	|| Response Type | Error |
    	|| Response Model | [Error Model|#ErrorModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "Unexpected error",
  "content" : {
    "application/json" : {
      "schema" : {
        "$ref" : "#/components/schemas/Error"
      }
    }
  }
}{code} |

h3. ssioAccounts/get

    *Summary:* Get Salesforce order lines by ad account id.
    *Description:* Get Salesforce order lines for account id &lt;code&gt;ad_account_id&lt;/code&gt;.
- The token&#39;s user_account must either be the Owner of the specified ad account, or have one of the necessary roles granted to them via &lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/share-and-manage-access-to-your-ad-accounts&quot;&gt;Business Access&lt;/a&gt;: Admin, Finance, Campaign.

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=get|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/ad_accounts/{ad_account_id}/ssio/order_lines{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |
----

h5. Path Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |ad_account_id |Unique identifier of an ad account. | String | (/) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  |

        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |bookmark |Cursor used to fetch the next page of items | String | (x) |null |  |  ||page_size |Maximum number of items to include in a single page of the response.
