h3. boardSections/create
{panel:title=boardSections/create|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Create board section
    *Description:* Create a board section on a board owned by the &quot;operation user_account&quot; - or on a group board that has been shared with this account.
Optional: Business Access: Specify an ad_account_id to use the owner of that ad_account as the &quot;operation user_account&quot;.
- By default, the &quot;operation user_account&quot; is the token user_account.

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=post|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/boards/{board_id}/sections{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |
----

h5. Path Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |board_id |Unique identifier of a board. | String | (/) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  |

h5. Body Parameter
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |BoardSection |Create a board section. | BoardSection | (/) | |  |  |


h5. Query Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |ad_account_id |Unique identifier of an ad account. | String | (x) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  |

h3. boards/create
{panel:title=boards/create|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Create board
    *Description:* Create a board owned by the &quot;operation user_account&quot;.
Optional: Business Access: Specify an ad_account_id to use the owner of that ad_account as the &quot;operation user_account&quot;.
- By default, the &quot;operation user_account&quot; is the token user_account.

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=post|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/boards{noformat} |

- By default, the &quot;operation user_account&quot; is the token user_account.

h3. boards/list
{panel:title=boards/list|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* List boards
    *Description:* Get a list of the boards owned by the &quot;operation user_account&quot; + group boards where this account is a collaborator
Optional: Business Access: Specify an ad_account_id to use the owner of that ad_account as the &quot;operation user_account&quot;.
Optional: Specify a privacy type (public, protected, or secret) to indicate which boards to return.
- If no privacy is specified, all boards that can be returned (based on the scopes of the token and ad_account role if applicable) will be returned.

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=get|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/boards{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |
----
h4. Parameters

        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |ad_account_id |Unique identifier of an ad account. | String | (x) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  ||bookmark |Cursor used to fetch the next page of items | String | (x) |null |  |  ||page_size |Maximum number of items to include in a single page of the response. See documentation on &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/reference/pagination/&#39;&gt;Pagination&lt;/a&gt; for more information. | Integer | (x) |25 |  |  ||privacy |Privacy setting for a board. | String | (x) |null |  | [ALL, PROTECTED, PUBLIC, SECRET, PUBLIC_AND_SECRET] |
----
h4. Responses

    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Green|title=200|subtle=false} |

If Pin was created before &lt;code&gt;2023-03-20&lt;/code&gt; lifetime metrics will only be available for Video and Idea Pin formats.     *Description:* Create an asynchronous report that may include information on campaigns, ad groups, product groups, ads,

h3. bulkRequest/get
{panel:title=bulkRequest/get|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Download advertiser entities in bulk
    *Description:* Get the status of a bulk request by &lt;code&gt;request_id&lt;/code&gt;, along with a download URL that will allow you to download the
new or updated entity data (campaigns, ad groups, product groups, ads, or keywords).

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=get|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/ad_accounts/{ad_account_id}/bulk/{bulk_request_id}{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |
----
h4. Parameters
h5. Path Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |ad_account_id |Unique identifier of an ad account. | String | (/) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  ||bulk_request_id |Unique identifier of a bulk upsert request. | String | (/) |null |  |  |



h5. Query Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |include_details |if set to True then attach the errors/details to all the requests | Boolean | (x) |false |  |  |
----
h4. Responses

    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Green|title=200|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Success |
    	|| Response Type | BulkUpsertStatusResponse |

    *Summary:* Create/update ad entities in bulk
    *Description:* Either create or update any combination of campaigns, ad groups, product groups, ads, or keywords.

that can be used to obtain the status of the request.

    *Summary:* List business assets
    *Description:* Get all the assets the requesting business has access to. This includes assets the business owns and assets the business has access to through partnerships.

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=get|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/businesses/{business_id}/assets{noformat} |

        |permissions |A list of asset permissions used to filter the assets. Used to fetch asset groups that contain the asset id as a child. | String | (x) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  ||asset_group_id |An asset group unique identifier. Used to fetch assets contained within the specified asset group. | String | (x) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  ||asset_type |A resource type to filter the assets by. Only assets of the specified type will be returned. | String | (x) |AD_ACCOUNT |  | [AD_ACCOUNT, PROFILE, ASSET_GROUP] ||start_index |An index to start fetching the results from. Only the results starting from this index will be returned. | Integer | (x) |0 |  |  ||bookmark |Cursor used to fetch the next page of items | String | (x) |null |  |  ||page_size |Maximum number of items to include in a single page of the response. See documentation on &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/reference/pagination/&#39;&gt;Pagination&lt;/a&gt; for more information. | Integer | (x) |25 |  |  |

    *Description:* Get assets on which you assigned asset permissions to the given member. Can be used to:
- get all assets, regardless of asset type or
- get assets of one asset type by using the asset_type query.

h3. businessPartnerAssetAccess/get
{panel:title=businessPartnerAssetAccess/get|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Get assets assigned to a partner or assets assigned by a partner
    *Description:* Can be used to get the business assets your partner has granted you access to or the business assets you have
granted your partner access to. If you specify:
- partner_type&#x3D;INTERNAL, you will retrieve your business assets that the partner has access to.
- partner_type&#x3D;EXTERNAL, you will retrieve the partner&#39;s business assets that the partner has granted you access to.

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=get|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/businesses/{business_id}/partners/{partner_id}/assets{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |

        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||

h5. Query Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |partner_type |Specifies whether to fetch internal or external (shared) partners.
If partner_type&#x3D;INTERNAL, the asset being queried is for accesses the partner has to your business assets.&lt;br&gt;
If partner_type&#x3D;EXTERNAL, the asset being queried is for the accesses you have to the partner&#39;s business asset. | PartnerType | (x) |null |  |  ||asset_type |A resource type to filter the assets by. Only assets of the specified type will be returned. | String | (x) |AD_ACCOUNT |  | [AD_ACCOUNT, PROFILE, ASSET_GROUP] ||start_index |An index to start fetching the results from. Only the results starting from this index will be returned. | Integer | (x) |0 |  |  ||page_size |Maximum number of items to include in a single page of the response. See documentation on &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/reference/pagination/&#39;&gt;Pagination&lt;/a&gt; for more information. | Integer | (x) |25 |  |  ||bookmark |Cursor used to fetch the next page of items | String | (x) |null |  |  |

h3. createAssetInvites
{panel:title=createAssetInvites|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Update invite/request with an asset permission
    *Description:* Assign asset permissions information to an existing invite/request. Can be used to:
- Request access to a partner&#39;s asset. Note: This is only for when no existing partnership exists. If an existing
  partnership exists, use &quot;Create a request to access an existing partner&#39;s assets&quot; to request access to your
  partner&#39;s assets.
    - invite_type&#x3D;&quot;PARTNER_REQUEST&quot;
- Invite a partner to access your business assets. Note: This is only for when there is no existing partnership.
  If there is an existing partnership, use &quot;Assign/Update partner asset permissions&quot; to assign a partner access to
  new assets.
    - invite_type&#x3D;&quot;PARTNER_INVITE&quot;
- Invite a member to access your business assets. Note: This is only for when there is no existing membership.
  If there is an existing membership, use &quot;Assign/Update member asset permissions&quot; to assign a member access to new
  assets.
    - invite_type&#x3D;&quot;MEMBER_INVITE&quot;

To learn more about permission levels, visit https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/business-manager-overview.

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=post|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/businesses/{business_id}/invites/assets/access{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |

        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |business_id |Unique identifier of the requesting business. | String | (/) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  |

h3. createMembershipOrPartnershipInvites
{panel:title=createMembershipOrPartnershipInvites|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Create invites or requests
    *Description:* Create batch invites or requests. Can create batch invites or requests as described below.
- Invite members to join the business. This would required specifying the following:
    - invite_type&#x3D;&quot;MEMBER_INVITE&quot;
    - business_role&#x3D;&quot;EMPLOYEE&quot; OR business_role&#x3D;&quot;BIZ_ADMIN&quot; (To learn more about business roles, visit
    https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/profile-permissions-in-business-access.)
    - members
- Invite partners to access your business assets. This would require specifying the following:
    - invite_type&#x3D;&quot;PARTNER_INVITE&quot;
    - business_role&#x3D;&quot;PARTNER&quot;
    - partners
- Request to be a partner so you can access their assets. This would require specifying the following:
    - invite_type&#x3D;&quot;PARTNER_REQUEST&quot;
    - business_role&#x3D;&quot;PARTNER&quot;
    - partners

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=post|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/businesses/{business_id}/invites{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |

h4. Parameters
h5. Path Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |business_id |Business id | String | (/) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  |

h5. Body Parameter
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |CreateMembershipOrPartnershipInvitesBody |An object with the properties: invite_type, partners, members, business_role | CreateMembershipOrPartnershipInvitesBody | (/) | |  |  |

        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||

    *Description:* Get all members of the specified business.

the user has permissions for and what those permissions are | Boolean | (x) |false |  |  ||business_roles |A list of business roles to filter the members by. h3. get/businessPartners
{panel:title=get/businessPartners|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Get business partners
    *Description:* Get all partners of the specified business.

If the assets_summary&#x3D;TRUE and:
- partner_type&#x3D;INTERNAL, the business assets returned are your business assets the partner has access to.
- partner_type&#x3D;EXTERNAL, the business assets returned are your partner&#39;s business assets the partner has granted you
  access to.

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=get|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/businesses/{business_id}/partners{noformat} |

If partner_type&#x3D;INTERNAL, the asset being queried is for accesses the partner has to your business assets.&lt;br&gt;
If partner_type&#x3D;EXTERNAL, the asset being queried is for the accesses you have to the partner&#39;s business asset. | PartnerType | (x) |null |  |  ||partner_ids |A list of business partner ids separated by commas used to filter the results. Only partners with the specified ids will be returned. | String | (x) |null |  |  ||start_index |An index to start fetching the results from. Only the results starting from this index will be returned. | Integer | (x) |0 |  |  ||page_size |Maximum number of items to include in a single page of the response. See documentation on &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/reference/pagination/&#39;&gt;Pagination&lt;/a&gt; for more information. | Integer | (x) |25 |  |  ||bookmark |Cursor used to fetch the next page of items | String | (x) |null |  |  |

h3. campaignTargetingAnalytics/get
{panel:title=campaignTargetingAnalytics/get|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Get targeting analytics for campaigns
    *Description:* Get targeting analytics for one or more campaigns.
For the requested account and metrics, the response will include the requested metric information
(e.g. SPEND_IN_DOLLAR) for the requested target type (e.g. &quot;age_bucket&quot;) for applicable values (e.g. &quot;45-49&quot;). &lt;p/&gt;
- The token&#39;s user_account must either be the Owner of the specified ad account, or have one
of the necessary roles granted to them via
&lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/share-and-manage-access-to-your-ad-accounts&quot;&gt;Business Access&lt;/a&gt;: Admin, Analyst, Campaign Manager.
- If granularity is not HOUR, the furthest back you can are allowed to pull data is 90 days before the current date in UTC time and the max time range supported is 90 days.
- If granularity is HOUR, the furthest back you can are allowed to pull data is 8 days before the current date in UTC time and the max time range supported is 3 days.

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=get|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/ad_accounts/{ad_account_id}/campaigns/targeting_analytics{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |
----
h4. Parameters
h5. Path Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |ad_account_id |Unique identifier of an ad account. | String | (/) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  |



h5. Query Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |campaign_ids |List of Campaign Ids to use to filter the results. | array[String] | (/) |null |  |  ||start_date |Metric report start date (UTC). Format: YYYY-MM-DD. Cannot be more than 90 days back from today. | date | (/) |null |  |  ||end_date |Metric report end date (UTC). Format: YYYY-MM-DD. Cannot be more than 90 days past start_date. | date | (/) |null |  |  ||targeting_types |Targeting type breakdowns for the report. The reporting per targeting type &lt;br&gt; is independent from each other. [&quot;AGE_BUCKET_AND_GENDER&quot;\] is in BETA and not yet available to all users. | array[AdsAnalyticsCampaignTargetingType] | (/) |null |  |  ||columns |Columns to retrieve, encoded as a comma-separated string. **NOTE**: Any metrics defined as MICRO_DOLLARS returns a value based on the advertiser profile&#39;s currency field. For USD,($1/1,000,000, or $0.000001 - one one-ten-thousandth of a cent). it&#39;s microdollars. Otherwise, it&#39;s in microunits of the advertiser&#39;s currency.&lt;br/&gt;For example, if the advertiser&#39;s currency is GBP (British pound sterling), all MICRO_DOLLARS fields will be in GBP microunits (1/1,000,000 British pound).&lt;br/&gt;If a column has no value, it may not be returned | array[String] | (/) |null |  |  ||granularity |TOTAL - metrics are aggregated over the specified date range.&lt;br&gt; DAY - metrics are broken down daily.&lt;br&gt; HOUR - metrics are broken down hourly.&lt;br&gt;WEEKLY - metrics are broken down weekly.&lt;br&gt;MONTHLY - metrics are broken down monthly | Granularity | (/) |null |  |  ||click_window_days |Number of days to use as the conversion attribution window for a pin click action. Applies to Pinterest Tag conversion metrics. Prior conversion tags use their defined attribution windows. If not specified, defaults to &#x60;30&#x60; days. | Integer | (x) |30 |  | [0, 1, 7, 14, 30, 60] ||engagement_window_days |Number of days to use as the conversion attribution window for an engagement action. Engagements include saves, closeups, link clicks, and carousel card swipes. Applies to Pinterest Tag conversion metrics. Prior conversion tags use their defined attribution windows. If not specified, defaults to &#x60;30&#x60; days. | Integer | (x) |30 |  | [0, 1, 7, 14, 30, 60] ||view_window_days |Number of days to use as the conversion attribution window for a view action. Applies to Pinterest Tag conversion metrics. Prior conversion tags use their defined attribution windows. If not specified, defaults to &#x60;1&#x60; day. | Integer | (x) |1 |  | [0, 1, 7, 14, 30, 60] ||conversion_report_time |The date by which the conversion metrics returned from this endpoint will be reported. There are two dates associated with a conversion event: the date that the user interacted with the ad, and the date that the user completed a conversion event. | String | (x) |TIME_OF_AD_ACTION |  | [TIME_OF_AD_ACTION, TIME_OF_CONVERSION] ||attribution_types |List of types of attribution for the conversion report | ConversionReportAttributionType | (x) |null |  |  |
----
h4. Responses

    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Green|title=200|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Success |
    	|| Response Type | MetricsResponse |
    	|| Response Model | [MetricsResponse Model|#MetricsResponseModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "Success",
  "content" : {
    "application/json" : {
      "schema" : {
        "$ref" : "#/components/schemas/MetricsResponse"
      }
    }
  }
}{code} |
       


    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Red|title=0|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Unexpected error |
    	|| Response Type | Error |
    	|| Response Model | [Error Model|#ErrorModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "Unexpected error",
  "content" : {
    "application/json" : {
      "schema" : {
        "$ref" : "#/components/schemas/Error"
      }
    }
  }
}{code} |
       

{panel}



h3. campaigns/analytics
{panel:title=campaigns/analytics|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Get campaign analytics
    *Description:* Get analytics for the specified campaigns in the specified &lt;code&gt;ad_account_id&lt;/code&gt;, filtered by the specified options.
- The token&#39;s user_account must either be the Owner of the specified ad account, or have one of the necessary roles granted to them via &lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/share-and-manage-access-to-your-ad-accounts&quot;&gt;Business Access&lt;/a&gt;: Admin, Analyst, Campaign Manager.
- If granularity is not HOUR, the furthest back you can are allowed to pull data is 90 days before the current date in UTC time and the max time range supported is 90 days.
- If granularity is HOUR, the furthest back you can are allowed to pull data is 8 days before the current date in UTC time and the max time range supported is 3 days.

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=get|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/ad_accounts/{ad_account_id}/campaigns/analytics{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |
----
h4. Parameters
h5. Path Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |ad_account_id |Unique identifier of an ad account. | String | (/) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  |



h5. Query Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |start_date |Metric report start date (UTC). Format: YYYY-MM-DD. Cannot be more than 90 days back from today. | date | (/) |null |  |  ||end_date |Metric report end date (UTC). Format: YYYY-MM-DD. Cannot be more than 90 days past start_date. | date | (/) |null |  |  ||campaign_ids |List of Campaign Ids to use to filter the results. | array[String] | (/) |null |  |  ||columns |Columns to retrieve, encoded as a comma-separated string. **NOTE**: Any metrics defined as MICRO_DOLLARS returns a value based on the advertiser profile&#39;s currency field. For USD,($1/1,000,000, or $0.000001 - one one-ten-thousandth of a cent). it&#39;s microdollars. Otherwise, it&#39;s in microunits of the advertiser&#39;s currency.&lt;br/&gt;For example, if the advertiser&#39;s currency is GBP (British pound sterling), all MICRO_DOLLARS fields will be in GBP microunits (1/1,000,000 British pound).&lt;br/&gt;If a column has no value, it may not be returned | array[String] | (/) |null |  |  ||granularity |TOTAL - metrics are aggregated over the specified date range.&lt;br&gt; DAY - metrics are broken down daily.&lt;br&gt; HOUR - metrics are broken down hourly.&lt;br&gt;WEEKLY - metrics are broken down weekly.&lt;br&gt;MONTHLY - metrics are broken down monthly | Granularity | (/) |null |  |  ||click_window_days |Number of days to use as the conversion attribution window for a pin click action. Applies to Pinterest Tag conversion metrics. Prior conversion tags use their defined attribution windows. If not specified, defaults to &#x60;30&#x60; days. | Integer | (x) |30 |  | [0, 1, 7, 14, 30, 60] ||engagement_window_days |Number of days to use as the conversion attribution window for an engagement action. Engagements include saves, closeups, link clicks, and carousel card swipes. Applies to Pinterest Tag conversion metrics. Prior conversion tags use their defined attribution windows. If not specified, defaults to &#x60;30&#x60; days. | Integer | (x) |30 |  | [0, 1, 7, 14, 30, 60] ||view_window_days |Number of days to use as the conversion attribution window for a view action. Applies to Pinterest Tag conversion metrics. Prior conversion tags use their defined attribution windows. If not specified, defaults to &#x60;1&#x60; day. | Integer | (x) |1 |  | [0, 1, 7, 14, 30, 60] ||conversion_report_time |The date by which the conversion metrics returned from this endpoint will be reported. There are two dates associated with a conversion event: the date that the user interacted with the ad, and the date that the user completed a conversion event. | String | (x) |TIME_OF_AD_ACTION |  | [TIME_OF_AD_ACTION, TIME_OF_CONVERSION] |
----
h4. Responses

    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Green|title=200|subtle=false} |

  "description" : "Success",
  "content" : {

    }
  }
}{code} |

{panel}



h3. campaigns/create
{panel:title=campaigns/create|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Create campaigns
    *Description:* Create multiple new campaigns. Every campaign has its own campaign_id and houses one or more ad groups, which contain one or more ads.
For more, see &lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/set-up-your-campaign/&quot;&gt;Set up your campaign&lt;/a&gt;. &lt;p/&gt;
&lt;strong&gt;Note:&lt;/strong&gt;
- The values for &#39;lifetime_spend_cap&#39; and &#39;daily_spend_cap&#39; are microcurrency amounts based on the currency field set in the advertiser&#39;s profile. (e.g. USD) &lt;p/&gt;
&lt;p&gt;Microcurrency is used to track very small transactions, based on the currency set in the advertiser’s profile.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;A microcurrency unit is 10^(-6) of the standard unit of currency selected in the advertiser’s profile.&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Equivalency equations&lt;/strong&gt;, using dollars as an example currency:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;ul&gt;
  &lt;li&gt;$1 &#x3D; 1,000,000 microdollars&lt;/li&gt;
  &lt;li&gt;1 microdollar &#x3D; $0.000001 &lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;
&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;To convert between currency and microcurrency&lt;/strong&gt;, using dollars as an example currency:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;ul&gt;
  &lt;li&gt;To convert dollars to microdollars, mutiply dollars by 1,000,000&lt;/li&gt;
  &lt;li&gt;To convert microdollars to dollars, divide microdollars by 1,000,000&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=post|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/ad_accounts/{ad_account_id}/campaigns{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |
----
h4. Parameters
h5. Path Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |ad_account_id |Unique identifier of an ad account. | String | (/) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  |

h5. Body Parameter
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |CampaignCreateRequest |Array of campaigns. | array[CampaignCreateRequest] | (/) | |  |  |


----
h4. Responses

    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Green|title=200|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | response |
    	|| Response Type | CampaignCreateResponse |
    	|| Response Model | [CampaignCreateResponse Model|#CampaignCreateResponseModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "response",
  "content" : {
    "application/json" : {
      "schema" : {
        "$ref" : "#/components/schemas/CampaignCreateResponse"
      }
    }
  }
}{code} |
       


    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Red|title=0|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Unexpected error |
    	|| Response Type | Error |
    	|| Response Model | [Error Model|#ErrorModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "Unexpected error",
  "content" : {
    "application/json" : {
      "schema" : {
        "$ref" : "#/components/schemas/Error"
      }
    }
  }
}{code} |

h3. campaigns/get

    *Description:* Get a specific campaign given the campaign ID.

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=get|subtle=false} |

h3. campaigns/list
{panel:title=campaigns/list|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* List campaigns
    *Description:* Get a list of the campaigns in the specified &lt;code&gt;ad_account_id&lt;/code&gt;, filtered by the specified options.
- The token&#39;s user_account must either be the Owner of the specified ad account, or have one of the necessary roles granted to them via &lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/share-and-manage-access-to-your-ad-accounts&quot;&gt;Business Access&lt;/a&gt;: Admin, Analyst, Campaign Manager.

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=get|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/ad_accounts/{ad_account_id}/campaigns{noformat} |

    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |

        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||

        |campaign_ids |List of Campaign Ids to use to filter the results. | array[String] | (x) |null |  |  ||entity_statuses |Entity status | array[String] | (x) |[&quot;ACTIVE&quot;,&quot;PAUSED&quot;] |  |  ||page_size |Maximum number of items to include in a single page of the response. See documentation on &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/reference/pagination/&#39;&gt;Pagination&lt;/a&gt; for more information. | Integer | (x) |25 |  |  ||order |The order in which to sort the items returned: “ASCENDING” or “DESCENDING”
by ID. Note that higher-value IDs are associated with more-recently added
items. | String | (x) |null |  | [ASCENDING, DESCENDING] ||bookmark |Cursor used to fetch the next page of items | String | (x) |null |  |  |
----

h3. campaigns/update
{panel:title=campaigns/update|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Update campaigns
    *Description:* Update multiple ad campaigns based on campaign_ids. &lt;p/&gt;
&lt;strong&gt;Note:&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;p/&gt;
 - &lt;p&gt;The values for &#39;lifetime_spend_cap&#39; and &#39;daily_spend_cap&#39; are microcurrency amounts based on the currency field set in the advertiser&#39;s profile. (e.g. USD) &lt;p/&gt;
&lt;p&gt;Microcurrency is used to track very small transactions, based on the currency set in the advertiser’s profile.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;A microcurrency unit is 10^(-6) of the standard unit of currency selected in the advertiser’ s profile.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Equivalency equations&lt;/strong&gt;, using dollars as an example currency:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;ul&gt;
  &lt;li&gt;$1 &#x3D; 1,000,000 microdollars&lt;/li&gt;
  &lt;li&gt;1 microdollar &#x3D; $0.000001 &lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;
&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;To convert between currency and microcurrency&lt;/strong&gt;, using dollars as an example currency:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;ul&gt;
  &lt;li&gt;To convert dollars to microdollars, mutiply dollars by 1,000,000&lt;/li&gt;
  &lt;li&gt;To convert microdollars to dollars, divide microdollars by 1,000,000&lt;/li&gt;
&lt;/ul&gt;

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=patch|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/ad_accounts/{ad_account_id}/campaigns{noformat} |

h3. catalogs/create
{panel:title=catalogs/create|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Create catalog
    *Description:* Create a new catalog owned by the &quot;operation user_account&quot;.
- By default, the &quot;operation user_account&quot; is the token user_account.

Optional: Business Access: Specify an &lt;code&gt;ad_account_id&lt;/code&gt; (obtained via &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/api/v5/#operation/ad_accounts/list&#39;&gt;List ad accounts&lt;/a&gt;) to use the owner of that ad_account as the &quot;operation user_account&quot;. In order to do this, the token user_account must have one of the following &lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/share-and-manage-access-to-your-ad-accounts&quot;&gt;Business Access&lt;/a&gt; roles on the ad_account: Owner, Admin, Catalogs Manager.

&lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/api-features/shopping-overview/&#39;&gt;Learn more&lt;/a&gt;

Note: this API only supports the catalog type of HOTEL for now.

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=post|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/catalogs{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |
----
h4. Parameters

h5. Body Parameter
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |CatalogsCreateRequest |Request object used to created a feed. | CatalogsCreateRequest | (/) | |  |  |


h5. Query Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |ad_account_id |Unique identifier of an ad account. | String | (x) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  |
----

    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Green|title=200|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Success |

        "$ref" : "#/components/schemas/Catalog"
      }
    }
  }
}{code} |
       


    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Orange|title=400|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Invalid parameters. |
    	|| Response Type | Error |
    	|| Response Model | [Error Model|#ErrorModelAnchor|Jump to model] |

h3. catalogs/list
{panel:title=catalogs/list|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* List catalogs
    *Description:* Fetch catalogs owned by the &quot;operation user_account&quot;.
- By default, the &quot;operation user_account&quot; is the token user_account.

Optional: Business Access: Specify an &lt;code&gt;ad_account_id&lt;/code&gt; (obtained via &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/api/v5/#operation/ad_accounts/list&#39;&gt;List ad accounts&lt;/a&gt;) to use the owner of that ad_account as the &quot;operation user_account&quot;. In order to do this, the token user_account must have one of the following &lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/share-and-manage-access-to-your-ad-accounts&quot;&gt;Business Access&lt;/a&gt; roles on the ad_account: Owner, Admin, Catalogs Manager.

&lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/api-features/shopping-overview/&#39;&gt;Learn more&lt;/a&gt;

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=get|subtle=false} |

h3. catalogsProductGroupPins/list
{panel:title=catalogsProductGroupPins/list|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* List products by product group
    *Description:* Get a list of product pins for a given Catalogs Product Group Id owned by the &quot;operation user_account&quot;.
- By default, the &quot;operation user_account&quot; is the token user_account.

Optional: Business Access: Specify an &lt;code&gt;ad_account_id&lt;/code&gt; (obtained via &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/api/v5/#operation/ad_accounts/list&#39;&gt;List ad accounts&lt;/a&gt;) to use the owner of that ad_account as the &quot;operation user_account&quot;. In order to do this, the token user_account must have one of the following &lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/share-and-manage-access-to-your-ad-accounts&quot;&gt;Business Access&lt;/a&gt; roles on the ad_account: Owner, Admin, Catalogs Manager.

&lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/api-features/shopping-overview/&#39;&gt;Learn more&lt;/a&gt;

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=get|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/catalogs/product_groups/{product_group_id}/products{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |
----
h4. Parameters
h5. Path Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |product_group_id |Unique identifier of a product group | String | (/) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  |



h5. Query Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |bookmark |Cursor used to fetch the next page of items | String | (x) |null |  |  ||page_size |Maximum number of items to include in a single page of the response. See documentation on &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/reference/pagination/&#39;&gt;Pagination&lt;/a&gt; for more information. | Integer | (x) |25 |  |  ||ad_account_id |Unique identifier of an ad account. | String | (x) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  ||pin_metrics |Specify whether to return 90d and lifetime Pin metrics. Total comments and total reactions are only available with lifetime Pin metrics. If Pin was created before &lt;code&gt;2023-03-20&lt;/code&gt; lifetime metrics will only be available for Video and Idea Pin formats. Lifetime metrics are available for all Pin formats since then. | Boolean | (x) |false |  |  |

h3. catalogsProductGroups/create
{panel:title=catalogsProductGroups/create|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Create product group
    *Description:* Create product group to use in Catalogs owned by the &quot;operation user_account&quot;.
- By default, the &quot;operation user_account&quot; is the token user_account.

Optional: Business Access: Specify an &lt;code&gt;ad_account_id&lt;/code&gt; (obtained via &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/api/v5/#operation/ad_accounts/list&#39;&gt;List ad accounts&lt;/a&gt;) to use the owner of that ad_account as the &quot;operation user_account&quot;. In order to do this, the token user_account must have one of the following &lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/share-and-manage-access-to-your-ad-accounts&quot;&gt;Business Access&lt;/a&gt; roles on the ad_account: Owner, Admin, Catalogs Manager.

&lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/api-features/shopping-overview/&#39;&gt;Learn more&lt;/a&gt;

Note: Access to the Creative Assets catalog type is restricted to a specific group of users.
If you require access, please reach out to your partner manager.

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=post|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/catalogs/product_groups{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |
----

h5. Body Parameter

        |MultipleProductGroupsInner |Request object used to create a single catalogs product groups. | MultipleProductGroupsInner | (/) | |  |  |

h3. catalogsProductGroups/createMany
{panel:title=catalogsProductGroups/createMany|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Create product groups
    *Description:* Create product group to use in Catalogs owned by the &quot;operation user_account&quot;.
- By default, the &quot;operation user_account&quot; is the token user_account.

Optional: Business Access: Specify an &lt;code&gt;ad_account_id&lt;/code&gt; (obtained via &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/api/v5/#operation/ad_accounts/list&#39;&gt;List ad accounts&lt;/a&gt;) to use the owner of that ad_account as the &quot;operation user_account&quot;. In order to do this, the token user_account must have one of the following &lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/share-and-manage-access-to-your-ad-accounts&quot;&gt;Business Access&lt;/a&gt; roles on the ad_account: Owner, Admin, Catalogs Manager.

&lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/api-features/shopping-overview/&#39;&gt;Learn more&lt;/a&gt;

Note: Access to the Creative Assets catalog type is restricted to a specific group of users.
If you require access, please reach out to your partner manager.

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=post|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/catalogs/product_groups/multiple{noformat} |

h3. catalogsProductGroups/delete
{panel:title=catalogsProductGroups/delete|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Delete product group
    *Description:* Delete a product group owned by the &quot;operation user_account&quot; from being in use in Catalogs.
- By default, the &quot;operation user_account&quot; is the token user_account.

Optional: Business Access: Specify an &lt;code&gt;ad_account_id&lt;/code&gt; (obtained via &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/api/v5/#operation/ad_accounts/list&#39;&gt;List ad accounts&lt;/a&gt;) to use the owner of that ad_account as the &quot;operation user_account&quot;. In order to do this, the token user_account must have one of the following &lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/share-and-manage-access-to-your-ad-accounts&quot;&gt;Business Access&lt;/a&gt; roles on the ad_account: Owner, Admin, Catalogs Manager.

&lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/api-features/shopping-overview/&#39;&gt;Learn more&lt;/a&gt;

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=delete|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/catalogs/product_groups/{product_group_id}{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |
----
h4. Parameters
h5. Path Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |product_group_id |Unique identifier of a product group | String | (/) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  |



h5. Query Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |ad_account_id |Unique identifier of an ad account. | String | (x) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  |
----
h4. Responses

    	|| Response Type |  |

  "description" : "Catalogs Product Group deleted successfully."

h3. catalogsProductGroups/deleteMany
{panel:title=catalogsProductGroups/deleteMany|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Delete product groups
    *Description:* Delete product groups owned by the &quot;operation user_account&quot;.
- By default, the &quot;operation user_account&quot; is the token user_account.

Optional: Business Access: Specify an &lt;code&gt;ad_account_id&lt;/code&gt; (obtained via &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/api/v5/#operation/ad_accounts/list&#39;&gt;List ad accounts&lt;/a&gt;) to use the owner of that ad_account as the &quot;operation user_account&quot;. In order to do this, the token user_account must have one of the following &lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/share-and-manage-access-to-your-ad-accounts&quot;&gt;Business Access&lt;/a&gt; roles on the ad_account: Owner, Admin, Catalogs Manager.

&lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/api-features/shopping-overview/&#39;&gt;Learn more&lt;/a&gt;

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=delete|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/catalogs/product_groups/multiple{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |
----
h4. Parameters



h5. Query Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |id |Comma-separated list of product group ids | array[Integer] | (/) |null |  |  ||ad_account_id |Unique identifier of an ad account. | String | (x) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  |

h3. catalogsProductGroups/get
{panel:title=catalogsProductGroups/get|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Get product group
    *Description:* Get a singe product group for a given Catalogs Product Group Id owned by the &quot;operation user_account&quot;.
- By default, the &quot;operation user_account&quot; is the token user_account.

Optional: Business Access: Specify an &lt;code&gt;ad_account_id&lt;/code&gt; (obtained via &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/api/v5/#operation/ad_accounts/list&#39;&gt;List ad accounts&lt;/a&gt;) to use the owner of that ad_account as the &quot;operation user_account&quot;. In order to do this, the token user_account must have one of the following &lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/share-and-manage-access-to-your-ad-accounts&quot;&gt;Business Access&lt;/a&gt; roles on the ad_account: Owner, Admin, Catalogs Manager.

&lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/api-features/shopping-overview/&#39;&gt;Learn more&lt;/a&gt;

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=get|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/catalogs/product_groups/{product_group_id}{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |
----
h4. Parameters
h5. Path Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |product_group_id |Unique identifier of a product group | String | (/) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  |



h5. Query Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||

h3. catalogsProductGroups/list
{panel:title=catalogsProductGroups/list|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* List product groups
    *Description:* Get a list of product groups for a given Catalogs Feed Id owned by the &quot;operation user_account&quot;.
- By default, the &quot;operation user_account&quot; is the token user_account.

Optional: Business Access: Specify an &lt;code&gt;ad_account_id&lt;/code&gt; (obtained via &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/api/v5/#operation/ad_accounts/list&#39;&gt;List ad accounts&lt;/a&gt;) to use the owner of that ad_account as the &quot;operation user_account&quot;. In order to do this, the token user_account must have one of the following &lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/share-and-manage-access-to-your-ad-accounts&quot;&gt;Business Access&lt;/a&gt; roles on the ad_account: Owner, Admin, Catalogs Manager.

&lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/api-features/shopping-overview/&#39;&gt;Learn more&lt;/a&gt;

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=get|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/catalogs/product_groups{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |
----
h4. Parameters



h5. Query Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |id |Comma-separated list of product group ids | array[Integer] | (x) |null |  |  ||feed_id |Filter entities for a given feed_id. If not given, all feeds are considered. | String | (x) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  ||catalog_id |Filter entities for a given catalog_id. If not given, all catalogs are considered. | String | (x) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  ||bookmark |Cursor used to fetch the next page of items | String | (x) |null |  |  ||page_size |Maximum number of items to include in a single page of the response. See documentation on &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/reference/pagination/&#39;&gt;Pagination&lt;/a&gt; for more information. | Integer | (x) |25 |  |  ||ad_account_id |Unique identifier of an ad account. | String | (x) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  |
----

h3. catalogsProductGroups/productCountsGet
{panel:title=catalogsProductGroups/productCountsGet|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Get product counts
    *Description:* Get a product counts for a given Catalogs Product Group owned by the &quot;operation user_account&quot;.
- By default, the &quot;operation user_account&quot; is the token user_account.

Optional: Business Access: Specify an &lt;code&gt;ad_account_id&lt;/code&gt; (obtained via &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/api/v5/#operation/ad_accounts/list&#39;&gt;List ad accounts&lt;/a&gt;) to use the owner of that ad_account as the &quot;operation user_account&quot;. In order to do this, the token user_account must have one of the following &lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/share-and-manage-access-to-your-ad-accounts&quot;&gt;Business Access&lt;/a&gt; roles on the ad_account: Owner, Admin, Catalogs Manager.

&lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/api-features/shopping-overview/&#39;&gt;Learn more&lt;/a&gt;

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=get|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/catalogs/product_groups/{product_group_id}/product_counts{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |
----
h4. Parameters
h5. Path Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |product_group_id |Unique identifier of a product group | String | (/) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  |



h5. Query Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |ad_account_id |Unique identifier of an ad account. | String | (x) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  |
----
h4. Responses

{panel}



h3. catalogsProductGroups/update
{panel:title=catalogsProductGroups/update|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Update single product group
    *Description:* Update product group owned by the &quot;operation user_account&quot; to use in Catalogs.
- By default, the &quot;operation user_account&quot; is the token user_account.

Optional: Business Access: Specify an &lt;code&gt;ad_account_id&lt;/code&gt; (obtained via &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/api/v5/#operation/ad_accounts/list&#39;&gt;List ad accounts&lt;/a&gt;) to use the owner of that ad_account as the &quot;operation user_account&quot;. In order to do this, the token user_account must have one of the following &lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/share-and-manage-access-to-your-ad-accounts&quot;&gt;Business Access&lt;/a&gt; roles on the ad_account: Owner, Admin, Catalogs Manager.

&lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/api-features/shopping-overview/&#39;&gt;Learn more&lt;/a&gt;

Note: Access to the Creative Assets catalog type is restricted to a specific group of users.
If you require access, please reach out to your partner manager.

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=patch|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/catalogs/product_groups/{product_group_id}{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |
----
h4. Parameters
h5. Path Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |product_group_id |Unique identifier of a product group | String | (/) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  |

h5. Body Parameter
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |CatalogsProductGroupsUpdateRequest |Request object used to Update a catalogs product group. | CatalogsProductGroupsUpdateRequest | (/) | |  |  |


h5. Query Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |ad_account_id |Unique identifier of an ad account. | String | (x) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  |
----
h4. Responses

    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Green|title=200|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Success |
    	|| Response Type | CatalogsVerticalProductGroup |
    	|| Response Model | [CatalogsVerticalProductGroup Model|#CatalogsVerticalProductGroupModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "Success",
  "content" : {
    "application/json" : {
      "schema" : {
        "$ref" : "#/components/schemas/CatalogsVerticalProductGroup"
      }
    }
  }
}{code} |

      }
    }

}{code} |

h3. feedProcessingResults/list
{panel:title=feedProcessingResults/list|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* List feed processing results
    *Description:* Fetch a feed processing results owned by the &quot;operation user_account&quot;. Please note that for now the bookmark parameter is not functional and only the first page will be available until it is implemented in some release in the near future.
- By default, the &quot;operation user_account&quot; is the token user_account.

Optional: Business Access: Specify an &lt;code&gt;ad_account_id&lt;/code&gt; (obtained via &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/api/v5/#operation/ad_accounts/list&#39;&gt;List ad accounts&lt;/a&gt;) to use the owner of that ad_account as the &quot;operation user_account&quot;. In order to do this, the token user_account must have one of the following &lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/share-and-manage-access-to-your-ad-accounts&quot;&gt;Business Access&lt;/a&gt; roles on the ad_account: Owner, Admin, Catalogs Manager.

&lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/api-features/shopping-overview/&#39;&gt;Learn more&lt;/a&gt;

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=get|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/catalogs/feeds/{feed_id}/processing_results{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |
----
h4. Parameters
h5. Path Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |feed_id |Unique identifier of a feed | String | (/) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  |



h5. Query Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |bookmark |Cursor used to fetch the next page of items | String | (x) |null |  |  ||page_size |Maximum number of items to include in a single page of the response. See documentation on &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/reference/pagination/&#39;&gt;Pagination&lt;/a&gt; for more information. | Integer | (x) |25 |  |  ||ad_account_id |Unique identifier of an ad account. | String | (x) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  |
----

    }

h3. feeds/create
{panel:title=feeds/create|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Create feed
    *Description:* Create a new feed owned by the &quot;operation user_account&quot;.
- By default, the &quot;operation user_account&quot; is the token user_account.

Please, be aware that &quot;default_country&quot;
and &quot;default_locale&quot; are not required in the spec for forward compatibility
but for now the API will not accept requests without those fields.

Optional: Business Access: Specify an &lt;code&gt;ad_account_id&lt;/code&gt; (obtained via &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/api/v5/#operation/ad_accounts/list&#39;&gt;List ad accounts&lt;/a&gt;) to use the owner of that ad_account as the &quot;operation user_account&quot;. In order to do this, the token user_account must have one of the following &lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/share-and-manage-access-to-your-ad-accounts&quot;&gt;Business Access&lt;/a&gt; roles on the ad_account: Owner, Admin, Catalogs Manager.

For Retail partners, refer to &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/before-you-get-started-with-catalogs&#39;&gt;Before you get started with Catalogs&lt;/a&gt;. For Hotel parterns, refer to &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/api-features/shopping-overview/&#39;&gt;Pinterest API for shopping&lt;/a&gt;.

Note: Access to the Creative Assets catalog type is restricted to a specific group of users.
If you require access, please reach out to your partner manager.

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=post|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/catalogs/feeds{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |
----
h4. Parameters

h5. Body Parameter
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |FeedsCreateRequest |Request object used to created a feed. | FeedsCreateRequest | (/) | |  |  |


h5. Query Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |ad_account_id |Unique identifier of an ad account. | String | (x) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  |

{panel}



h3. feeds/delete
{panel:title=feeds/delete|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Delete feed
    *Description:* Delete a feed owned by the &quot;operating user_account&quot;.
- By default, the &quot;operation user_account&quot; is the token user_account.

Optional: Business Access: Specify an &lt;code&gt;ad_account_id&lt;/code&gt; (obtained via &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/api/v5/#operation/ad_accounts/list&#39;&gt;List ad accounts&lt;/a&gt;) to use the owner of that ad_account as the &quot;operation user_account&quot;. In order to do this, the token user_account must have one of the following &lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/share-and-manage-access-to-your-ad-accounts&quot;&gt;Business Access&lt;/a&gt; roles on the ad_account: Owner, Admin, Catalogs Manager.

For Retail partners, refer to &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/before-you-get-started-with-catalogs&#39;&gt;Before you get started with Catalogs&lt;/a&gt;. For Hotel parterns, refer to &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/api-features/shopping-overview/&#39;&gt;Pinterest API for shopping&lt;/a&gt;.

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=delete|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/catalogs/feeds/{feed_id}{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |
----
h4. Parameters
h5. Path Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |feed_id |Unique identifier of a feed | String | (/) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  |



h5. Query Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |ad_account_id |Unique identifier of an ad account. | String | (x) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  |

    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Green|title=204|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Feed deleted successfully. |
    	|| Response Type |  |
    	|| Response Model | [ Model|#ModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "Feed deleted successfully."
}{code} |
       


    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Orange|title=400|subtle=false} |

            "code" : 1,
            "message" : "'feed_id' value '1511851494501_' must match the pattern: ^\\d+$\"}"
          }
        }
      }
    }
  }
}{code} |

    	|| Message | Forbidden. Account not approved for feed mutations yet. |
    	|| Response Type | Error |
    	|| Response Model | [Error Model|#ErrorModelAnchor|Jump to model] |

          "value" : {
            "code" : 2625,
            "message" : "Sorry, you cannot perform this action as your account has been disapproved. Please see business hub for more details. https://www.pinterest.com/business/hub/"
          }
        },
        "MerchantUnderReview" : {
          "value" : {
            "code" : 2626,
            "message" : "We are reviewing your account. Please see business hub for more details. https://www.pinterest.com/business/hub/"
          }
        }
      }
    }
  }
}{code} |

          }
        }
      }
    }
  }
}{code} |

    	|| Message | Conflict. Can&#39;t delete a feed with active promotions. |

h3. feeds/get
{panel:title=feeds/get|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Get feed
    *Description:* Get a single feed owned by the &quot;operation user_account&quot;.
- By default, the &quot;operation user_account&quot; is the token user_account.

Optional: Business Access: Specify an &lt;code&gt;ad_account_id&lt;/code&gt; (obtained via &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/api/v5/#operation/ad_accounts/list&#39;&gt;List ad accounts&lt;/a&gt;) to use the owner of that ad_account as the &quot;operation user_account&quot;. In order to do this, the token user_account must have one of the following &lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/share-and-manage-access-to-your-ad-accounts&quot;&gt;Business Access&lt;/a&gt; roles on the ad_account: Owner, Admin, Catalogs Manager.

For Retail partners, refer to &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/before-you-get-started-with-catalogs&#39;&gt;Before you get started with Catalogs&lt;/a&gt;. For Hotel parterns, refer to &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/api-features/shopping-overview/&#39;&gt;Pinterest API for shopping&lt;/a&gt;.

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=get|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/catalogs/feeds/{feed_id}{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |
----
h4. Parameters
h5. Path Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |feed_id |Unique identifier of a feed | String | (/) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  |



h5. Query Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |ad_account_id |Unique identifier of an ad account. | String | (x) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  |
----
h4. Responses

    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Green|title=200|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Success |
    	|| Response Type | CatalogsFeed |

      }
    }
  }

          }
        }
      }
    }
  }
}{code} |

    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{

h3. feeds/ingest
{panel:title=feeds/ingest|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Ingest feed items
    *Description:* Ingest items for a given feed owned by the &quot;operation user_account&quot;.

Optional: Business Access: Specify an &lt;code&gt;ad_account_id&lt;/code&gt; (obtained via &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/api/v5/#operation/ad_accounts/list&#39;&gt;List ad accounts&lt;/a&gt;) to use the owner of that ad_account as the &quot;operation user_account&quot;. In order to do this, the token user_account must have one of the following &lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/share-and-manage-access-to-your-ad-accounts&quot;&gt;Business Access&lt;/a&gt; roles on the ad_account: Owner, Admin, Catalogs Manager.

&lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/api-features/shopping-overview/&#39;&gt;Learn more&lt;/a&gt;

Note: This endpoint is restricted to a specific group of users. If you require access, please reach out to your partner manager.

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=post|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/catalogs/feeds/{feed_id}/ingest{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |
----
h4. Parameters
h5. Path Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |feed_id |Unique identifier of a feed | String | (/) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  |



h5. Query Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |ad_account_id |Unique identifier of an ad account. | String | (x) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  |

h3. feeds/list
{panel:title=feeds/list|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* List feeds
    *Description:* Fetch feeds owned by the &quot;operation user_account&quot;.
- By default, the &quot;operation user_account&quot; is the token user_account.

Optional: Business Access: Specify an &lt;code&gt;ad_account_id&lt;/code&gt; (obtained via &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/api/v5/#operation/ad_accounts/list&#39;&gt;List ad accounts&lt;/a&gt;) to use the owner of that ad_account as the &quot;operation user_account&quot;. In order to do this, the token user_account must have one of the following &lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/share-and-manage-access-to-your-ad-accounts&quot;&gt;Business Access&lt;/a&gt; roles on the ad_account: Owner, Admin, Catalogs Manager.

For Retail partners, refer to &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/before-you-get-started-with-catalogs&#39;&gt;Before you get started with Catalogs&lt;/a&gt;. For Hotel parterns, refer to &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/api-features/shopping-overview/&#39;&gt;Pinterest API for shopping&lt;/a&gt;.

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=get|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/catalogs/feeds{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |
----
h4. Parameters



h5. Query Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |bookmark |Cursor used to fetch the next page of items | String | (x) |null |  |  ||page_size |Maximum number of items to include in a single page of the response. See documentation on &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/reference/pagination/&#39;&gt;Pagination&lt;/a&gt; for more information. | Integer | (x) |25 |  |  ||catalog_id |Filter entities for a given catalog_id. If not given, all catalogs are considered. | String | (x) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  ||ad_account_id |Unique identifier of an ad account. | String | (x) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  |
----
h4. Responses

    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Green|title=200|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Success |
    	|| Response Type | feeds_list_200_response |
    	|| Response Model | [feeds_list_200_response Model|#feeds_list_200_responseModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "Success",
  "content" : {
    "application/json" : {
      "schema" : {
        "$ref" : "#/components/schemas/feeds_list_200_response"
      }
    }
  }
}{code} |
       


    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Orange|title=400|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Invalid parameters. |
    	|| Response Type | Error |
    	|| Response Model | [Error Model|#ErrorModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "Invalid parameters.",
  "content" : {
    "application/json" : {
      "schema" : {
        "$ref" : "#/components/schemas/Error"
      },
      "examples" : {

          "value" : {
            "code" : 1,
            "message" : "Parameter 'page_size' was not numeric (was 3e)\""
          }
        }
      }
    }
  }
}{code} |
       


    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Orange|title=401|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Unauthorized access. |

h3. feeds/update
{panel:title=feeds/update|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Update feed
    *Description:* Update a feed owned by the &quot;operation user_account&quot;.
- By default, the &quot;operation user_account&quot; is the token user_account.

Optional: Business Access: Specify an &lt;code&gt;ad_account_id&lt;/code&gt; (obtained via &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/api/v5/#operation/ad_accounts/list&#39;&gt;List ad accounts&lt;/a&gt;) to use the owner of that ad_account as the &quot;operation user_account&quot;. In order to do this, the token user_account must have one of the following &lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/share-and-manage-access-to-your-ad-accounts&quot;&gt;Business Access&lt;/a&gt; roles on the ad_account: Owner, Admin, Catalogs Manager.

For Retail partners, refer to &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/before-you-get-started-with-catalogs&#39;&gt;Before you get started with Catalogs&lt;/a&gt;. For Hotel parterns, refer to &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/api-features/shopping-overview/&#39;&gt;Pinterest API for shopping&lt;/a&gt;.

Note: Access to the Creative Assets catalog type is restricted to a specific group of users.
If you require access, please reach out to your partner manager.

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=patch|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/catalogs/feeds/{feed_id}{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |
----
h4. Parameters
h5. Path Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |feed_id |Unique identifier of a feed | String | (/) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  |

h5. Body Parameter
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |FeedsUpdateRequest |Request object used to update a feed. | FeedsUpdateRequest | (/) | |  |  |


h5. Query Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |ad_account_id |Unique identifier of an ad account. | String | (x) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  |
----
h4. Responses

    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Green|title=200|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Success |
    	|| Response Type | CatalogsFeed |
    	|| Response Model | [CatalogsFeed Model|#CatalogsFeedModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "Success",
  "content" : {
    "application/json" : {
      "schema" : {
        "$ref" : "#/components/schemas/CatalogsFeed"
      }
    }
  }
}{code} |
       


    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Orange|title=400|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Invalid feed parameters. |
    	|| Response Type | Error |
    	|| Response Model | [Error Model|#ErrorModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "Invalid feed parameters.",
  "content" : {
    "application/json" : {
      "schema" : {
        "$ref" : "#/components/schemas/Error"
      },
      "examples" : {
        "InvalidRequest" : {
          "value" : {
            "code" : 1,
            "message" : "Invalid request: ..."
          }
        }
      }
    }
  }
}{code} |
       


    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Orange|title=403|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Forbidden. Account not approved for feed mutations yet. |
    	|| Response Type | Error |
    	|| Response Model | [Error Model|#ErrorModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "Forbidden. Account not approved for feed mutations yet.",
  "content" : {
    "application/json" : {
      "schema" : {
        "$ref" : "#/components/schemas/Error"
      },
      "examples" : {
        "MerchantDisapproved" : {
          "value" : {
            "code" : 2625,
            "message" : "Sorry, you cannot perform this action as your account has been disapproved. Please see business hub for more details. https://www.pinterest.com/business/hub/"
          }
        },
        "MerchantUnderReview" : {
          "value" : {
            "code" : 2626,
            "message" : "We are reviewing your account. Please see business hub for more details. https://www.pinterest.com/business/hub/"
          }
        }
      }
    }
  }
}{code} |
       


    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Orange|title=404|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Data feed not found. |
    	|| Response Type | Error |
    	|| Response Model | [Error Model|#ErrorModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "Data feed not found.",
  "content" : {
    "application/json" : {
      "schema" : {

      },
      "examples" : {
        "FeedNotFound" : {
          "value" : {
            "code" : 4161,
            "message" : "Sorry! We could not find your catalogs feed."
          }
        }

}{code} |

h3. items/get
{panel:title=items/get|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Get catalogs items
    *Description:* Get the items of the catalog owned by the &quot;operation user_account&quot;. &lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;/docs/api-features/shopping-overview/#Update%20items%20in%20batch&quot; target&#x3D;&quot;_blank&quot;&gt;See detailed documentation here.&lt;/a&gt;
- By default, the &quot;operation user_account&quot; is the token user_account.

Optional: Business Access: Specify an &lt;code&gt;ad_account_id&lt;/code&gt; (obtained via &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/api/v5/#operation/ad_accounts/list&#39;&gt;List ad accounts&lt;/a&gt;) to use the owner of that ad_account as the &quot;operation user_account&quot;. In order to do this, the token user_account must have one of the following &lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/share-and-manage-access-to-your-ad-accounts&quot;&gt;Business Access&lt;/a&gt; roles on the ad_account: Owner, Admin, Catalogs Manager.

Note: this endpoint is deprecated and will be deleted soon. Please use &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/api/v5/#operation/items/post&#39;&gt;Get catalogs items (POST)&lt;/a&gt; instead.

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=get|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/catalogs/items{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |
----
h4. Parameters



h5. Query Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |ad_account_id |Unique identifier of an ad account. | String | (x) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  ||country |Country for the Catalogs Items | String | (/) |null |  |  ||language |Language for the Catalogs Items | String | (/) |null |  |  ||item_ids |This parameter is deprecated. Use filters instead. | array[String] | (x) |null |  |  ||filters |Identifies items to be retrieved. This is a required parameter. | CatalogsItemsFilters | (x) |null |  |  |
----
h4. Responses

    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Green|title=200|subtle=false} |

      }
    }
  }
}{code} |

            "code" : 1,

          }
        }
      }
    }
  }
}{code} |

          }
        }
      }

  }

h3. items/post
{panel:title=items/post|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Get catalogs items (POST)
    *Description:* Get the items of the catalog owned by the &quot;operation user_account&quot;. &lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;/docs/api-features/shopping-overview/#Update%20items%20in%20batch&quot; target&#x3D;&quot;_blank&quot;&gt;See detailed documentation here.&lt;/a&gt;
- By default, the &quot;operation user_account&quot; is the token user_account.

Optional: Business Access: Specify an &lt;code&gt;ad_account_id&lt;/code&gt; (obtained via &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/api/v5/#operation/ad_accounts/list&#39;&gt;List ad accounts&lt;/a&gt;) to use the owner of that ad_account as the &quot;operation user_account&quot;. In order to do this, the token user_account must have one of the following &lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/share-and-manage-access-to-your-ad-accounts&quot;&gt;Business Access&lt;/a&gt; roles on the ad_account: Owner, Admin, Catalogs Manager.

Note: Access to the Creative Assets catalog type is restricted to a specific group of users.
If you require access, please reach out to your partner manager.

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=post|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/catalogs/items{noformat} |

h3. itemsBatch/get
{panel:title=itemsBatch/get|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Get item batch status
    *Description:* Get a single catalogs items batch owned by the &quot;operating user_account&quot;. &lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;/docs/api-features/shopping-overview/#Update%20items%20in%20batch&quot; target&#x3D;&quot;_blank&quot;&gt;See detailed documentation here.&lt;/a&gt;
- By default, the &quot;operation user_account&quot; is the token user_account.

Optional: Business Access: Specify an &lt;code&gt;ad_account_id&lt;/code&gt; (obtained via &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/api/v5/#operation/ad_accounts/list&#39;&gt;List ad accounts&lt;/a&gt;) to use the owner of that ad_account as the &quot;operation user_account&quot;. In order to do this, the token user_account must have one of the following &lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/share-and-manage-access-to-your-ad-accounts&quot;&gt;Business Access&lt;/a&gt; roles on the ad_account: Owner, Admin, Catalogs Manager.

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=get|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/catalogs/items/batch/{batch_id}{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |
