h3. pins/save
{panel:title=pins/save|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Save Pin
    *Description:* Save a Pin on a board or board section owned by the &quot;operation user_account&quot;.
- By default, the &quot;operation user_account&quot; is the token user_account.
Optional: Business Access: Specify an &lt;code&gt;ad_account_id&lt;/code&gt; (obtained via &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/api/v5/#operation/ad_accounts/list&#39;&gt;List ad accounts&lt;/a&gt;) to use the owner of that ad_account as the &quot;operation user_account&quot;. In order to do this, the token user_account must have one of the following &lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/share-and-manage-access-to-your-ad-accounts&quot;&gt;Business Access&lt;/a&gt; roles on the ad_account:

- For Pins on public or protected boards: Owner, Admin, Analyst, Campaign Manager.
- For Pins on secret boards: Owner, Admin.

- Any Pin type can be saved: image Pin, video Pin, Idea Pin, product Pin, etc.
- Any public Pin can be saved given a pin ID.

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=post|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/pins/{pin_id}/save{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |
----
h4. Parameters
h5. Path Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |pin_id |Unique identifier of a Pin. | String | (/) |null |  |  |

h5. Body Parameter
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |PinsSaveRequest |Request object used to save an existing pin | PinsSaveRequest | (/) | |  |  |


h5. Query Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |ad_account_id |Unique identifier of an ad account. | String | (x) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  |
----
h4. Responses

    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Green|title=201|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Successfully saved pin. |
    	|| Response Type | Pin |
    	|| Response Model | [Pin Model|#PinModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "Successfully saved pin.",
  "content" : {
    "application/json" : {
      "schema" : {
        "$ref" : "#/components/schemas/Pin"
      }
    }
  }
}{code} |
       


    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Orange|title=403|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Not authorized to access Board or Pin. |
    	|| Response Type | Error |
    	|| Response Model | [Error Model|#ErrorModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "Not authorized to access Board or Pin.",
  "content" : {
    "application/json" : {
      "schema" : {
        "$ref" : "#/components/schemas/Error"
      },
      "example" : {
        "code" : 29,
        "message" : "You are not permitted to access that resource."
      }
    }
  }
}{code} |
       


    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Orange|title=404|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Board or Pin not found. |
    	|| Response Type | Error |
    	|| Response Model | [Error Model|#ErrorModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "Board or Pin not found.",
  "content" : {
    "application/json" : {

      },
      "examples" : {
        "BoardNotFound" : {
          "value" : {
            "code" : 40,
            "message" : "Board not found."
          }
        },
        "PinNotFound" : {
          "value" : {
            "code" : 50,
            "message" : "Pin not found."
          }
        },
        "BoardSectionNotFound" : {
          "value" : {
            "code" : 2031,
            "message" : "Sorry! We couldn't find this board section."
          }
        }
      }
    }
  }
}{code} |
       


    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Red|title=0|subtle=false} |

h3. pins/update
{panel:title=pins/update|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Update Pin
    *Description:* Update a pin owned by the &quot;operating user_account&quot;.
- By default, the &quot;operation user_account&quot; is the token user_account.

Optional: Business Access: Specify an &lt;code&gt;ad_account_id&lt;/code&gt; (obtained via &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/api/v5/#operation/ad_accounts/list&#39;&gt;List ad accounts&lt;/a&gt;) to use the owner of that ad_account as the &quot;operation user_account&quot;. In order to do this, the token user_account must have one of the following &lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/share-and-manage-access-to-your-ad-accounts&quot;&gt;Business Access&lt;/a&gt; roles on the ad_account:

- For Pins on public or protected boards: Owner, Admin, Analyst, Campaign Manager.
- For Pins on secret boards: Owner, Admin.

&lt;strong&gt;This endpoint is currently in beta and not available to all apps. &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/getting-started/beta-and-advanced-access/&#39;&gt;Learn more&lt;/a&gt;.&lt;/strong&gt;

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=patch|subtle=false} |

h3. productGroupPromotions/list
{panel:title=productGroupPromotions/list|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Get product group promotions
    *Description:* List existing product group promotions associated with an ad account.

Include either ad_group_id or product_group_promotion_ids in your request.

&lt;b&gt;Note:&lt;/b&gt; ad_group_ids and product_group_promotion_ids are mutually exclusive parameters.
Only provide one. If multiple options are provided, product_group_promotion_ids takes precedence over ad_group_ids. If none are provided, the endpoint returns an error.

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=get|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/ad_accounts/{ad_account_id}/product_group_promotions{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |
----
h4. Parameters
h5. Path Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |ad_account_id |Unique identifier of an ad account. | String | (/) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  |



h5. Query Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |product_group_promotion_ids |List of Product group promotion Ids. | array[String] | (x) |null |  |  ||entity_statuses |Entity status | array[String] | (x) |[&quot;ACTIVE&quot;,&quot;PAUSED&quot;] |  |  ||ad_group_id |Ad group Id. | String | (x) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  ||page_size |Maximum number of items to include in a single page of the response. See documentation on &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/reference/pagination/&#39;&gt;Pagination&lt;/a&gt; for more information. | Integer | (x) |25 |  |  ||order |The order in which to sort the items returned: “ASCENDING” or “DESCENDING”
by ID. Note that higher-value IDs are associated with more-recently added
items. | String | (x) |null |  | [ASCENDING, DESCENDING] ||bookmark |Cursor used to fetch the next page of items | String | (x) |null |  |  |

h3. productGroups/analytics
{panel:title=productGroups/analytics|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Get product group analytics
    *Description:* Get analytics for the specified product groups in the specified &lt;code&gt;ad_account_id&lt;/code&gt;, filtered by the specified options.
- The token&#39;s user_account must either be the Owner of the specified ad account, or have one of the necessary roles granted to them via &lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/share-and-manage-access-to-your-ad-accounts&quot;&gt;Business Access&lt;/a&gt;: Admin, Analyst, Campaign Manager.
- If granularity is not HOUR, the furthest back you can are allowed to pull data is 90 days before the current date in UTC time and the max time range supported is 90 days.
- If granularity is HOUR, the furthest back you can are allowed to pull data is 8 days before the current date in UTC time and the max time range supported is 3 days.

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=get|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/ad_accounts/{ad_account_id}/product_groups/analytics{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |
----
h4. Parameters
h5. Path Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |ad_account_id |Unique identifier of an ad account. | String | (/) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  |



h5. Query Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |start_date |Metric report start date (UTC). Format: YYYY-MM-DD. Cannot be more than 90 days back from today. | date | (/) |null |  |  ||end_date |Metric report end date (UTC). Format: YYYY-MM-DD. Cannot be more than 90 days past start_date. | date | (/) |null |  |  ||product_group_ids |List of Product group Ids to use to filter the results. | array[String] | (/) |null |  |  ||columns |Columns to retrieve, encoded as a comma-separated string. **NOTE**: Any metrics defined as MICRO_DOLLARS returns a value based on the advertiser profile&#39;s currency field. For USD,($1/1,000,000, or $0.000001 - one one-ten-thousandth of a cent). it&#39;s microdollars. Otherwise, it&#39;s in microunits of the advertiser&#39;s currency.&lt;br/&gt;For example, if the advertiser&#39;s currency is GBP (British pound sterling), all MICRO_DOLLARS fields will be in GBP microunits (1/1,000,000 British pound).&lt;br/&gt;If a column has no value, it may not be returned | array[String] | (/) |null |  |  ||granularity |TOTAL - metrics are aggregated over the specified date range.&lt;br&gt; DAY - metrics are broken down daily.&lt;br&gt; HOUR - metrics are broken down hourly.&lt;br&gt;WEEKLY - metrics are broken down weekly.&lt;br&gt;MONTHLY - metrics are broken down monthly | Granularity | (/) |null |  |  ||click_window_days |Number of days to use as the conversion attribution window for a pin click action. Applies to Pinterest Tag conversion metrics. Prior conversion tags use their defined attribution windows. If not specified, defaults to &#x60;30&#x60; days. | Integer | (x) |30 |  | [0, 1, 7, 14, 30, 60] ||engagement_window_days |Number of days to use as the conversion attribution window for an engagement action. Engagements include saves, closeups, link clicks, and carousel card swipes. Applies to Pinterest Tag conversion metrics. Prior conversion tags use their defined attribution windows. If not specified, defaults to &#x60;30&#x60; days. | Integer | (x) |30 |  | [0, 1, 7, 14, 30, 60] ||view_window_days |Number of days to use as the conversion attribution window for a view action. Applies to Pinterest Tag conversion metrics. Prior conversion tags use their defined attribution windows. If not specified, defaults to &#x60;1&#x60; day. | Integer | (x) |1 |  | [0, 1, 7, 14, 30, 60] ||conversion_report_time |The date by which the conversion metrics returned from this endpoint will be reported. There are two dates associated with a conversion event: the date that the user interacted with the ad, and the date that the user completed a conversion event. | String | (x) |TIME_OF_AD_ACTION |  | [TIME_OF_AD_ACTION, TIME_OF_CONVERSION] |

h3. targetingOptions/get
{panel:title=targetingOptions/get|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Get targeting options
    *Description:* &lt;p&gt;You can use targeting values in ads placement to define your intended audience. &lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;Targeting metrics are organized around targeting specifications.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;For more information on ads targeting, see &lt;a class&#x3D;&quot;reference external&quot; href&#x3D;&quot;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/audience-targeting&quot; target&#x3D;&quot;_blank&quot;&gt;Audience targeting&lt;/a&gt;.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;&lt;b&gt;Sample return:&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;pre class&#x3D;&quot;literal-block&quot;&gt; [\{&amp;quot;36313&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;Australia: Moreton Bay - North&amp;quot;, &amp;quot;124735&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;Canada: North Battleford&amp;quot;, &amp;quot;36109&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;Australia: Murray&amp;quot;, &amp;quot;36108&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;Australia: Mid North Coast&amp;quot;, &amp;quot;36101&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;Australia: Capital Region&amp;quot;, &amp;quot;811&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;U.S.: Reno&amp;quot;, &amp;quot;36103&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;Australia: Central West&amp;quot;, &amp;quot;36102&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;Australia: Central Coast&amp;quot;, &amp;quot;36105&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;Australia: Far West and Orana&amp;quot;, &amp;quot;36104&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;Australia: Coffs Harbour - Grafton&amp;quot;, &amp;quot;36107&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;Australia: Illawarra&amp;quot;, &amp;quot;36106&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;Australia: Hunter Valley Exc Newcastle&amp;quot;, &amp;quot;554017&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;New Zealand: Wanganui&amp;quot;, &amp;quot;554016&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;New Zealand: Marlborough&amp;quot;, &amp;quot;554015&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;New Zealand: Gisborne&amp;quot;, &amp;quot;554014&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;New Zealand: Tararua&amp;quot;, &amp;quot;554013&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;New Zealand: Invercargill&amp;quot;, &amp;quot;GR&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;Greece&amp;quot;, &amp;quot;554011&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;New Zealand: Whangarei&amp;quot;, &amp;quot;554010&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;New Zealand: Far North&amp;quot;, &amp;quot;717&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;U.S.: Quincy-Hannibal-Keokuk&amp;quot;, &amp;quot;716&amp;quot;: &amp;quot;U.S.: Baton Rouge&amp;quot;,...\}\] &lt;/pre&gt;

h3. searchPartnerPins
{panel:title=searchPartnerPins|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Search pins by a given search term
    *Description:* &lt;strong&gt;This endpoint is currently in beta and not available to all apps. &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/getting-started/beta-and-advanced-access/&#39;&gt;Learn more&lt;/a&gt;.&lt;/strong&gt;

Get the top 10 Pins by a given search term.

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=get|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/search/partner/pins{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |
----
h4. Parameters



h5. Query Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |term |Search term to look up pins. | String | (/) |null |  |  ||country_code |Two letter country code (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2) | String | (/) |null |  |  ||bookmark |Cursor used to fetch the next page of items | String | (x) |null |  |  ||locale |Search locale. | String | (x) |null |  |  ||limit |Max search result size | Integer | (x) |10 |  |  |
----
h4. Responses

    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Green|title=200|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Success |
    	|| Response Type | search_partner_pins_200_response |
    	|| Response Model | [search_partner_pins_200_response Model|#search_partner_pins_200_responseModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "Success",
  "content" : {
    "application/json" : {
      "schema" : {
        "$ref" : "#/components/schemas/search_partner_pins_200_response"
      }
    }
  }
}{code} |
       


    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Orange|title=400|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Invalid pins |
    	|| Response Type | Error |
    	|| Response Model | [Error Model|#ErrorModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "Invalid pins",
  "content" : {
    "application/json" : {
      "schema" : {
        "$ref" : "#/components/schemas/Error"
      },
      "example" : {
        "code" : 400,
        "message" : "Invalid pin filter value"
      }
    }
  }
}{code} |
       


    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Red|title=0|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Unexpected error |
    	|| Response Type | Error |
    	|| Response Model | [Error Model|#ErrorModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "Unexpected error",
  "content" : {

h3. searchUserBoards/get
{panel:title=searchUserBoards/get|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Search user&#39;s boards
    *Description:* Search for boards for the &quot;operation user_account&quot;. This includes boards of all board types.
- By default, the &quot;operation user_account&quot; is the token user_account.

If using Business Access: Specify an ad_account_id to use the owner of that ad_account as the &quot;operation user_account&quot;. See &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/getting-started/using-business-access/&#39;&gt;Understanding Business Access&lt;/a&gt; for more information.

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=get|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/search/boards{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |
----
h4. Parameters



h5. Query Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |ad_account_id |Unique identifier of an ad account. | String | (x) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  ||bookmark |Cursor used to fetch the next page of items | String | (x) |null |  |  ||page_size |Maximum number of items to include in a single page of the response. See documentation on &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/reference/pagination/&#39;&gt;Pagination&lt;/a&gt; for more information. | Integer | (x) |25 |  |  ||query |Search query. Can contain pin description keywords or comma-separated pin IDs. | String | (x) |null |  |  |
----
h4. Responses

    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Green|title=200|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | response |
    	|| Response Type | search_user_boards_get_200_response |
    	|| Response Model | [search_user_boards_get_200_response Model|#search_user_boards_get_200_responseModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "response",
  "content" : {
    "application/json" : {
      "schema" : {
        "$ref" : "#/components/schemas/search_user_boards_get_200_response"
      }
    }
  }
}{code} |
       


    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Red|title=0|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Unexpected error |
    	|| Response Type | Error |
    	|| Response Model | [Error Model|#ErrorModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "Unexpected error",
  "content" : {
    "application/json" : {
      "schema" : {
        "$ref" : "#/components/schemas/Error"
      }
    }
  }
}{code} |

    *Description:* Search for pins for the &quot;operation user_account&quot;.
- By default, the &quot;operation user_account&quot; is the token user_account.

If using Business Access: Specify an ad_account_id to use the owner of that ad_account as the &quot;operation user_account&quot;. See &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/getting-started/using-business-access/&#39;&gt;Understanding Business Access&lt;/a&gt; for more information.

        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||

h3. targetingTemplate/create
{panel:title=targetingTemplate/create|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Create targeting templates
    *Description:* &lt;p&gt;Targeting templates allow advertisers to save a set of targeting details including audience lists,
 keywords &amp; interest, demographics, and placements to use more than once during the campaign creation process.&lt;/p&gt;
 &lt;p&gt;Templates can be used to build out basic targeting criteria that you plan to use across campaigns and to reuse
  performance targeting from prior campaigns for new campaigns.&lt;/p&gt;

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=post|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/ad_accounts/{ad_account_id}/targeting_templates{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |
----
h4. Parameters
h5. Path Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |ad_account_id |Unique identifier of an ad account. | String | (/) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  |

h5. Body Parameter
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |TargetingTemplateCreate |targeting template creation entity | TargetingTemplateCreate | (/) | |  |  |


----
h4. Responses

    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Green|title=200|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Success |
    	|| Response Type | TargetingTemplateGetResponseData |
    	|| Response Model | [TargetingTemplateGetResponseData Model|#TargetingTemplateGetResponseDataModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "Success",
  "content" : {
    "application/json" : {
      "schema" : {
        "$ref" : "#/components/schemas/TargetingTemplateGetResponseData"
      }
    }
  }
}{code} |
       


    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Orange|title=400|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Invalid ad account id. |
    	|| Response Type | Error |
    	|| Response Model | [Error Model|#ErrorModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "Invalid ad account id.",
  "content" : {
    "application/json" : {
      "schema" : {
        "$ref" : "#/components/schemas/Error"
      },
      "example" : {
        "code" : 400,

      }
    }
  }
}{code} |

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=get|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |

        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||

        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||

by ID. Note that higher-value IDs are associated with more-recently added
items. | String | (x) |null |  | [ASCENDING, DESCENDING] ||include_sizing |Include audience sizing in result or not | Boolean | (x) |false |  |  ||search_query |Search keyword for targeting templates | String | (x) |null |  |  ||page_size |Maximum number of items to include in a single page of the response. See documentation on &lt;a href&#x3D;&#39;/docs/reference/pagination/&#39;&gt;Pagination&lt;/a&gt; for more information. | Integer | (x) |25 |  |  ||bookmark |Cursor used to fetch the next page of items | String | (x) |null |  |  |

    *Summary:* List related terms
    *Description:* Get a list of terms logically related to each input term. &lt;p/&gt;
Example: the term &#39;workout&#39; would list related terms like &#39;one song workout&#39;, &#39;yoga workout&#39;, &#39;workout motivation&#39;, etc.

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=get|subtle=false} |

h3. termsSuggested/list
{panel:title=termsSuggested/list|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* List suggested terms
    *Description:* Get popular search terms that begin with your input term. &lt;p/&gt;
Example: &#39;sport&#39; would return popular terms like &#39;sports bar&#39; and &#39;sportswear&#39;, but not &#39;motor sports&#39; since the phrase does not begin with the given term.

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=get|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/terms/suggested{noformat} |

h3. termsOfService/get

    *Summary:* Get terms of service
    *Description:* Get the text of the terms of service and see whether the advertiser has accepted the terms of service.

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=get|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/ad_accounts/{ad_account_id}/terms_of_service{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |
----
h4. Parameters
h5. Path Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |ad_account_id |Unique identifier of an ad account. | String | (/) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  |



h5. Query Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |include_html |Return HTML in TOS text. | Boolean | (x) |false |  |  ||tos_type |Request type. | String | (x) |null |  |  |
----

    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Green|title=200|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Success |
    	|| Response Type | TermsOfService |
    	|| Response Model | [TermsOfService Model|#TermsOfServiceModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "Success",
  "content" : {
    "application/json" : {
      "schema" : {
        "$ref" : "#/components/schemas/TermsOfService"
      }
    }

h3. userAccount/analytics
{panel:title=userAccount/analytics|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Get user account analytics
    *Description:* Get analytics for the &quot;operation user_account&quot;
- By default, the &quot;operation user_account&quot; is the token user_account.

Optional: Business Access: Specify an ad_account_id to use the owner of that ad_account as the &quot;operation user_account&quot;.

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=get|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/user_account/analytics{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |
----
h4. Parameters



h5. Query Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |start_date |Metric report start date (UTC). Format: YYYY-MM-DD. Cannot be more than 90 days back from today. | date | (/) |null |  |  ||end_date |Metric report end date (UTC). Format: YYYY-MM-DD. Cannot be more than 90 days past start_date. | date | (/) |null |  |  ||from_claimed_content |Filter on Pins that match your claimed domain. | String | (x) |BOTH |  | [OTHER, CLAIMED, BOTH] ||pin_format |Pin formats to get data for, default is all. | String | (x) |ALL |  | [ALL, ORGANIC_IMAGE, ORGANIC_PRODUCT, ORGANIC_VIDEO, ADS_STANDARD, ADS_PRODUCT, ADS_VIDEO, ADS_IDEA] ||app_types |Apps or devices to get data for, default is all. | String | (x) |ALL |  | [ALL, MOBILE, TABLET, WEB] ||content_type |Filter to paid or organic data. Default is all. | String | (x) |ALL |  | [ALL, PAID, ORGANIC] ||source |Filter to activity from Pins created and saved by your, or activity created and saved by others from your claimed accounts | String | (x) |ALL |  | [ALL, YOUR_PINS, OTHER_PINS] ||metric_types |Metric types to get data for, default is all.  | array[String] | (x) |null |  |  ||split_field |How to split the data into groups. Not including this param means data won&#39;t be split. | String | (x) |NO_SPLIT |  | [NO_SPLIT, APP_TYPE, OWNED_CONTENT, SOURCE, PIN_FORMAT] ||ad_account_id |Unique identifier of an ad account. | String | (x) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  |
----
h4. Responses

    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Green|title=200|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Success |
    	|| Response Type | map[String, AnalyticsMetricsResponse] |
    	|| Response Model | [map[String, AnalyticsMetricsResponse] Model|#map[String, AnalyticsMetricsResponse]ModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "Success",
  "content" : {
    "application/json" : {
      "schema" : {
        "$ref" : "#/components/schemas/AnalyticsResponse"
      }
    }
  }
}{code} |
       


    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Orange|title=400|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Invalid user accounts analytics parameters. |
    	|| Response Type | Error |
    	|| Response Model | [Error Model|#ErrorModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "Invalid user accounts analytics parameters.",
  "content" : {
    "application/json" : {
      "schema" : {
        "$ref" : "#/components/schemas/Error"
      },
      "example" : {
        "code" : 400,
        "message" : "Invalid user accounts analytics parameters."
      }
    }
  }
}{code} |
       


    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Orange|title=403|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Not authorized to access the user account analytics. |
    	|| Response Type | Error |
    	|| Response Model | [Error Model|#ErrorModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "Not authorized to access the user account analytics.",
  "content" : {
    "application/json" : {

        "$ref" : "#/components/schemas/Error"
      },
      "example" : {
        "code" : 403,
        "message" : "Not authorized to access the user account analytics."
      }
    }
  }

h3. userAccount/analytics/topPins
{panel:title=userAccount/analytics/topPins|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#003b6f|titleBGColor=#003b6f|titleColor=#a6b8c7|bgColor=#ffffff}
    *Summary:* Get user account top pins analytics
    *Description:* Gets analytics data about a user&#39;s top pins (limited to the top 50).
- By default, the &quot;operation user_account&quot; is the token user_account.

Optional: Business Access: Specify an ad_account_id to use the owner of that ad_account as the &quot;operation user_account&quot;.

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=get|subtle=false} |
    || Protocol | {noformat:nopanel=true}https{noformat} |
    || Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}/user_account/analytics/top_pins{noformat} |
    || Base Path | {noformat:nopanel=true}https://api.pinterest.com/v5{noformat} |
    || Produces | {noformat:nopanel=true}application/json {noformat} |
----
h4. Parameters



h5. Query Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |start_date |Metric report start date (UTC). Format: YYYY-MM-DD. Cannot be more than 90 days back from today. | date | (/) |null |  |  ||end_date |Metric report end date (UTC). Format: YYYY-MM-DD. Cannot be more than 90 days past start_date. | date | (/) |null |  |  ||sort_by |Specify sorting order for metrics | String | (/) |null |  | [ENGAGEMENT, IMPRESSION, OUTBOUND_CLICK, PIN_CLICK, SAVE] ||from_claimed_content |Filter on Pins that match your claimed domain. | String | (x) |BOTH |  | [OTHER, CLAIMED, BOTH] ||pin_format |Pin formats to get data for, default is all. | String | (x) |ALL |  | [ALL, ORGANIC_IMAGE, ORGANIC_PRODUCT, ORGANIC_VIDEO, ADS_STANDARD, ADS_PRODUCT, ADS_VIDEO, ADS_IDEA] ||app_types |Apps or devices to get data for, default is all. | String | (x) |ALL |  | [ALL, MOBILE, TABLET, WEB] ||content_type |Filter to paid or organic data. Default is all. | String | (x) |ALL |  | [ALL, PAID, ORGANIC] ||source |Filter to activity from Pins created and saved by your, or activity created and saved by others from your claimed accounts | String | (x) |ALL |  | [ALL, YOUR_PINS, OTHER_PINS] ||metric_types |Metric types to get data for, default is all.  | array[String] | (x) |null |  |  ||num_of_pins |Number of pins to include, default is 10. Max is 50. | Integer | (x) |10 |  |  ||created_in_last_n_days |Get metrics for pins created in the last &quot;n&quot; days. | Integer | (x) |null |  | [30] ||ad_account_id |Unique identifier of an ad account. | String | (x) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  |
----
h4. Responses

    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Green|title=200|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Success |
    	|| Response Type | TopPinsAnalyticsResponse |
    	|| Response Model | [TopPinsAnalyticsResponse Model|#TopPinsAnalyticsResponseModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "Success",
  "content" : {
    "application/json" : {
      "schema" : {
        "$ref" : "#/components/schemas/TopPinsAnalyticsResponse"
      }
    }
  }
}{code} |
       


    	|| Status Code | {status:colour=Orange|title=403|subtle=false} |
    	|| Message | Not authorized to access the user account analytics. |
    	|| Response Type | Error |
    	|| Response Model | [Error Model|#ErrorModelAnchor|Jump to model] |
    	|| Response Schema | {code:collapse=true}{
  "description" : "Not authorized to access the user account analytics.",
  "content" : {
    "application/json" : {
      "schema" : {
        "$ref" : "#/components/schemas/Error"
      },
      "example" : {
        "code" : 403,
        "message" : "Not authorized to access the user account analytics."
      }
    }
  }
}{code} |

    *Summary:* Get user account top video pins analytics
    *Description:* Gets analytics data about a user&#39;s top video pins (limited to the top 50).
- By default, the &quot;operation user_account&quot; is the token user_account.

	|| HttpMethod | {status:colour=Yellow|title=get|subtle=false} |

----
h4. Parameters



h5. Query Parameters
        ||Name||Description||Type||Required||Default||Pattern||Enum||Example||
        |start_date |Metric report start date (UTC). Format: YYYY-MM-DD. Cannot be more than 90 days back from today. | date | (/) |null |  |  ||end_date |Metric report end date (UTC). Format: YYYY-MM-DD. Cannot be more than 90 days past start_date. | date | (/) |null |  |  ||sort_by |Specify sorting order for video metrics | String | (/) |null |  | [IMPRESSION, SAVE, OUTBOUND_CLICK, VIDEO_MRC_VIEW, VIDEO_AVG_WATCH_TIME, VIDEO_V50_WATCH_TIME, QUARTILE_95_PERCENT_VIEW, VIDEO_10S_VIEW, VIDEO_START] ||from_claimed_content |Filter on Pins that match your claimed domain. | String | (x) |BOTH |  | [OTHER, CLAIMED, BOTH] ||pin_format |Pin formats to get data for, default is all. | String | (x) |ALL |  | [ALL, ORGANIC_IMAGE, ORGANIC_PRODUCT, ORGANIC_VIDEO, ADS_STANDARD, ADS_PRODUCT, ADS_VIDEO, ADS_IDEA] ||app_types |Apps or devices to get data for, default is all. | String | (x) |ALL |  | [ALL, MOBILE, TABLET, WEB] ||content_type |Filter to paid or organic data. Default is all. | String | (x) |ALL |  | [ALL, PAID, ORGANIC] ||source |Filter to activity from Pins created and saved by your, or activity created and saved by others from your claimed accounts | String | (x) |ALL |  | [ALL, YOUR_PINS, OTHER_PINS] ||metric_types |Metric types to get video data for, default is all.  | array[String] | (x) |null |  |  ||num_of_pins |Number of pins to include, default is 10. Max is 50. | Integer | (x) |10 |  |  ||created_in_last_n_days |Get metrics for pins created in the last &quot;n&quot; days. | Integer | (x) |null |  | [30] ||ad_account_id |Unique identifier of an ad account. | String | (x) |null | /^\\d+$/ |  |
----

    *Summary:* Get user account
    *Description:* Get account information for the &quot;operation user_account&quot;
- By default, the &quot;operation user_account&quot; is the token user_account.

        {anchor:AdGroupAudienceSizingResponseModelAnchor}
        h3. AdGroupAudienceSizingResponse

        

        
        ||Field Name||Required||Type||Description||Enum||Example||
         |audience_size_lower_bound |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}BigDecimal{noformat} | The lower confidence bound of the estimated potential audience size. &quot;Potential audience size&quot; estimates the number of people you may be able to reach per month with your campaign. It is based on historical advertising data and the targeting criteria you select. It does not guarantee results or take into account factors such as bid, budget, schedule, seasonality or product experiments. |  | 100000
         |audience_size_upper_bound |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}BigDecimal{noformat} | The upper confidence bound of the estimated potential audience size. &quot;Potential audience size&quot; estimates the number of people you may be able to reach per month with your campaign.         {anchor:AdGroupCommonModelAnchor}
        h3. AdGroupCommon

        

        
        ||Field Name||Required||Type||Description||Enum||Example||
         |name |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}String{noformat} | Ad group name. |  | Ad Group For Pin: 687195905986
         |status |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}EntityStatus{noformat} | Ad group/entity status. |  | null
         |budget_in_micro_currency |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}Integer{noformat} | Budget in micro currency. This field is **REQUIRED** for non-CBO (campaign budget optimization) campaigns.  A CBO campaign automatically generates ad group budgets from its campaign budget to maximize campaign outcome. A CBO campaign is limited to 70 or less ad groups. |  | 5000000
         |bid_in_micro_currency |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}Integer{noformat} | Bid price in micro currency. This field is **REQUIRED** for the following campaign objective_type/billable_event combinations: AWARENESS/IMPRESSION, CONSIDERATION/CLICKTHROUGH, CATALOG_SALES/CLICKTHROUGH, VIDEO_VIEW/VIDEO_V_50_MRC. |  | 5000000
         |optimization_goal_metadata |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}OptimizationGoalMetadata{noformat} | Optimization goals for objective-based performance campaigns. **REQUIRED** when campaign&#39;s &#x60;objective_type&#x60; is set to &#x60;&quot;WEB_CONVERSION&quot;&#x60;. |  | null
         |budget_type |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}BudgetType{noformat} |  |  | null

         |end_time |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}Integer{noformat} | Ad group end time. Unix timestamp in seconds. |  | 5705424000
         |targeting_spec |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}TargetingSpec{noformat} |  |  | null
         |lifetime_frequency_cap |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}Integer{noformat} | Set a limit to the number of times a promoted pin from this campaign can be impressed by a pinner within the past rolling 30 days. Only available for CPM (cost per mille (1000 impressions))  ad groups. A CPM ad group has an IMPRESSION &lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;/docs/redoc/#section/Billable-event&quot;&gt;billable_event&lt;/a&gt; value. This field **REQUIRES** the &#x60;end_time&#x60; field. |  | 100
         |tracking_urls |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}TrackingUrls{noformat} | Third-party tracking URLs.&lt;br&gt; JSON object with the format: \{&quot;&lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;/docs/redoc/#section/Tracking-URL-event&quot;&gt;Tracking event enum&lt;/a&gt;&quot;:[URL string array\],...\}&lt;br&gt; For example: \{&quot;impression&quot;: [&quot;URL1&quot;, &quot;URL2&quot;\], &quot;click&quot;: [&quot;URL1&quot;, &quot;URL2&quot;, &quot;URL3&quot;\]\}.&lt;br&gt;Up to three tracking URLs are supported for each event type. Tracking URLs set at the ad group or ad level can override those set at the campaign level. May be null. Pass in an empty object - \{\} - to remove tracking URLs.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt; For more information, see &lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/third-party-and-dynamic-tracking&quot; target&#x3D;&quot;_blank&quot;&gt;Third-party and dynamic tracking&lt;/a&gt;. |  | null

         |start_date |(/) |{noformat:nopanel=true}String{noformat} | Metric report start date (UTC). Format: YYYY-MM-DD |  | 2020-12-20
         |end_date |(/) |{noformat:nopanel=true}String{noformat} | Metric report end date (UTC). Format: YYYY-MM-DD |  | 2020-12-20
         |granularity |(/) |{noformat:nopanel=true}Granularity{noformat} | TOTAL - metrics are aggregated over the specified date range.&lt;br&gt; DAY - metrics are broken down daily.&lt;br&gt; HOUR - metrics are broken down hourly.&lt;br&gt;WEEKLY - metrics are broken down weekly.&lt;br&gt;MONTHLY - metrics are broken down monthly |  | null
         |click_window_days |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}ConversionAttributionWindowDays{noformat} | Number of days to use as the conversion attribution window for a pin click action. Applies to Pinterest Tag conversion metrics. Prior conversion tags use their defined attribution windows. If not specified, defaults to &#x60;30&#x60; days. |  | null
         |engagement_window_days |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}ConversionAttributionWindowDays{noformat} | Number of days to use as the conversion attribution window for an engagement action. Engagements include saves, closeups, link clicks, and carousel card swipes. Applies to Pinterest Tag conversion metrics. Prior conversion tags use their defined attribution windows. If not specified, defaults to &#x60;30&#x60; days. |  | null
         |view_window_days |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}ConversionAttributionWindowDays{noformat} | Number of days to use as the conversion attribution window for a view action.          |report_format |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}DataOutputFormat{noformat} | Specification for formatting the report data. Reports in JSON will not zero-fill metrics, whereas reports in CSV will. Both report formats will omit rows where all the columns are equal to 0. |  | null
         |primary_sort |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}String{noformat} | Whether to first sort the report by date or by entity ID of the reporting entity level.          |start_hour |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}Integer{noformat} | Which hour of the start date to begin the report. The entire day will be included if no start hour is provided. Only allowed for hourly reports. |  | null
         |end_hour |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}Integer{noformat} | Which hour of the end date to stop the report (inclusive). For example, with an end_date of &#39;2020-01-01&#39; and end_hour of &#39;15&#39;, the report will contain metrics up to &#39;2020-01-01 14:59:59&#39;. The entire day will be included if no end hour is provided. Only allowed for hourly reports. |  | null

        {anchor:AppTypeMultipliersModelAnchor}
        h3. AppTypeMultipliers

        This represents a mapping from app type targeting criteria to a bid price adjustment.

Multiplier values must be between 0 and 10. A value of 10 represents a 900% increase in bid price (from $1 to $10 for example). A value of 0 will stop distribution for this item on the specified app type in `MAX_BID` ad groups in `CATALOG_SALES` campaigns. All app type multipliers must be set at the same time. If a multiplier is not provided it is assumed to be 1 (no bid adjustment).

        
        ||Field Name||Required||Type||Description||Enum||Example||
         |APP_TYPE |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}TargetingSpecAppType{noformat} |  |  | null

        {anchor:AudienceRuleModelAnchor}
        h3. AudienceRule

        JSON object defining targeted audience users. Example rule formats per audience type:<br>CUSTOMER_LIST: \{ "customer_list_id": "&lt;customer list ID&gt;"\}<br>ACTALIKE: \{ "seed_id": ["&lt;audience ID&gt;"\], "country": "US", "percentage": "10" \}<br>(Valid countries include: "US", "CA", and "GB". Percentage should be 1-10.<br>The targeted audience should be this % size across Pinterest.)<br>VISITOR: \{ "visitor_source_id": ["&lt;conversion tag ID&gt;"\], "retention_days": "180", "event_source": \{"=": ["web", "mobile"\]\}, "ingestion_source": \{"=": ["tag"\]\}\}<br>(Retention days should be 1-540. Retention applies to specific customers.)<br>ENGAGEMENT: \{"engagement_domain": ["www.entomi.com"\], "engager_type": 1\}<br>For more details on engagement audiences, see <a href="/docs/redoc/adtech_ads_v4/#section/November-2021" target="_blank">November 2021 changelog</a>.

        
        ||Field Name||Required||Type||Description||Enum||Example||
         |country |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}String{noformat} | Valid countries include: &quot;US&quot;, &quot;CA&quot;, and &quot;GB&quot;. |  | US
         |customer_list_id |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}String{noformat} | Customer list ID. For CUSTOMER_LIST &#x60;audience_type&#x60;. |  | 5497558859876
         |engagement_domain |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}array[String]{noformat} | The audience account&#39;s verified domain. **Required** for ENGAGEMENT &#x60;audience_type&#x60;. |  | [&quot;www.somedomain.com&quot;]
         |engagement_type |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}String{noformat} | Engagement type enum. Optional for ENGAGEMENT &#x60;audience_type&#x60;. Supported values are &#x60;click&#x60;, &#x60;save&#x60;, &#x60;closeup&#x60;, &#x60;comment&#x60; and &#x60;like&#x60;. All engagements are included if this field is not set.  |  | click
         |event |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}String{noformat} | A Pinterest tag event. Optional for VISITOR &#x60;audience_type&#x60;. Possible values are &#x60;pagevisit&#x60;, &#x60;signup&#x60;, &#x60;checkout&#x60;, &#x60;viewcategory&#x60;, &#x60;search&#x60;, &#x60;addtocart&#x60;, &#x60;watchvideo&#x60;, &#x60;lead&#x60;, and &#x60;custom&#x60;. This field also accepts a partner-defined Pinterest tag event. |  | checkout
         |event_data |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}PinterestTagEventData{noformat} |  |  | null
         |percentage |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}Integer{noformat} | Percentage should be 1-10. The targeted audience should be this % size across Pinterest. |  | 3
         |pin_id |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}array[String]{noformat} | IDs of engaged organic pins. Optional for ENGAGEMENT &#x60;audience_type&#x60;. For example, &quot;pin_id:&quot;: [&quot;34567&quot;\] |  | [&quot;34567&quot;]
         |prefill |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}Boolean{noformat} | Optional for VISITOR &#x60;audience_type&#x60;. If &#x60;true&#x60;, the specified rule on existing engagement data is applied to pre-populate the audience. If &#x60;false&#x60;, the audience is empty at creation time. The default is &#x60;true&#x60;. |  | true
         |retention_days |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}Integer{noformat} | Number of days a Pinterest user remains in the audience. Optional for ENGAGEMENT and VISITOR &#x60;audience_type&#x60;. Accepted range is 1-540. Defaults to 180 if not specified. |  | 30
         |seed_id |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}array[String]{noformat} | Audience ID(s). For ACTALIKE &#x60;audience_type&#x60;.  |  | [&quot;2542620639259&quot;,&quot;2542620639261&quot;]
         |url |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}array[String]{noformat} | Optional for ENGAGEMENT or VISITOR &#x60;audience_type&#x60;. For ENGAGEMENT, it is the engaged pin&#39;s URL.         {anchor:BudgetTypeModelAnchor}
        h3. BudgetType

        Budget type. If DAILY, an ad group's daily spend will not exceed the budget parameter value. If LIFETIME, the end_time parameter is **REQUIRED**, and the ad group spend is spread evenly between the ad group `start_time` and `end_time` range. A CBO campaign automatically generates ad group budgets from its campaign budget to maximize campaign outcome. For CBO campaigns, only "CBO_ADGROUP" is allowed. For WEB_SESSIONS campaigns, only "LIFETIME" is allowed. For update, only draft ad groups may update budget type.

         ||Name||Value||Description||
          |DAILY |"DAILY" | |
 |LIFETIME |"LIFETIME" | |
 |CBO_ADGROUP |"CBO_ADGROUP" | |

         |entity_ids |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}array[String]{noformat} | All entities specified by these IDs as well as their children and grandchildren will be downloaded if the entity type is one of the types requested to be downloaded. |  | null

        {anchor:BusinessRoleModelAnchor}
        h3. BusinessRole

        The access level a member/partner has to the business. Values are case-sensitive.
<br> - EMPLOYEE: Can only view and access assets you assign to them.
They cannot see details about other employees, partners, or other assets.
<br> - BIZ_ADMIN: Have full control of roles and can add employees and partners as well as grant asset access.
<br> - PARTNER: Can only view and access assets you assign them to/or they assign to you.

         ||Name||Value||Description||
          |EMPLOYEE |"EMPLOYEE" | |
 |BIZ_ADMIN |"BIZ_ADMIN" | |
 |PARTNER |"PARTNER" | |
         
        
        {anchor:BusinessRoleCheckModeModelAnchor}
        h3. BusinessRoleCheckMode

        Specifies if the partner is internal or external.

         ||Name||Value||Description||
          |INTERNAL |"INTERNAL" | |
 |EXTERNAL |"EXTERNAL" | |
         
        
        {anchor:BusinessRoleForMembersModelAnchor}
        h3. BusinessRoleForMembers

        The access level a member has to the business. Values are case-sensitive.
<br> - EMPLOYEE: Can only view and access assets you assign to them.
They cannot see details about other employees, partners, or other assets.
<br> - BIZ_ADMIN: Have full control of roles and can add employees and partners as well as grant asset access.

         ||Name||Value||Description||
          |EMPLOYEE |"EMPLOYEE" | |
 |BIZ_ADMIN |"BIZ_ADMIN" | |

         |PRICE_MISSING |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}Integer{noformat} | Some products are missing a price, those items will not be published. |  | null
         |FEED_TOO_SMALL |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}Integer{noformat} | Your feed couldn&#39;t be validated because the file doesn&#39;t contain the minimum number of lines required. |  | null
         |MAX_ITEMS_PER_ITEM_GROUP_EXCEEDED |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}Integer{noformat} | Some items exceed the maximum number of items per item group, those items will not be published. |  | null
         |ITEM_MAIN_IMAGE_DOWNLOAD_FAILURE |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}Integer{noformat} | Some items&#39; main images can&#39;t be found. |  | null
         |PINJOIN_CONTENT_UNSAFE |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}Integer{noformat} | Some items were not published because they don&#39;t meet Pinterest&#39;s Merchant Guidelines. |  | null
         |BLOCKLISTED_IMAGE_SIGNATURE |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}Integer{noformat} | Some items were not published because they don&#39;t meet Pinterest&#39;s Merchant Guidelines. |  | null
         |LIST_PRICE_INVALID |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}Integer{noformat} | Some items have list price formatting errors in their product metadata, those items will not be published. |  | null
         |PRICE_CANNOT_BE_DETERMINED |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}Integer{noformat} | Some items were not published because price cannot be determined. The price, list price, and sale price are all different, so those items will not be published. |  | null

          |ACTIVE |"ACTIVE" | |
 |INACTIVE |"INACTIVE" | |
         
        
        {anchor:CatalogsProductGroupTypeModelAnchor}
        h3. CatalogsProductGroupType

        <p>Catalog product group type</p>
<p>MERCHANT_CREATED: Product groups created by merchants.
<br>ALL_PRODUCTS: Consists of every product in your latest successful feed upload.
<br>BEST_DEALS: Consists of products with the deepest drop in price.
<br>PINNER_FAVORITES: Consists of products that are resonating most with people on Pinterest, based on engagement.
<br>TOP_SELLERS: Consists of products with the highest conversion rate, if you have the conversion tag installed.
<br>BACK_IN_STOCK: Consists of products that were previously out of stock and are now in stock.
<br>NEW_ARRIVALS: Consists of products that are new to your Catalog.
<br>SHOPIFY_COLLECTION: Product groups created based on Shopify Product Collections.
<br>I2PC: Product groups created based on predicted product category.</p>

         ||Name||Value||Description||
          |MERCHANT_CREATED |"MERCHANT_CREATED" | |
 |ALL_PRODUCTS |"ALL_PRODUCTS" | |
 |BEST_DEALS |"BEST_DEALS" | |
 |PINNER_FAVORITES |"PINNER_FAVORITES" | |
 |TOP_SELLERS |"TOP_SELLERS" | |
 |BACK_IN_STOCK |"BACK_IN_STOCK" | |
 |NEW_ARRIVALS |"NEW_ARRIVALS" | |
 |SHOPIFY_COLLECTIONS |"SHOPIFY_COLLECTIONS" | |
 |I2PC |"I2PC" | |
         
        
        {anchor:CatalogsProductGroupUpdateRequestModelAnchor}
        h3. CatalogsProductGroupUpdateRequest

        Request object for updating a product group.

        
        ||Field Name||Required||Type||Description||Enum||Example||

        h3. CatalogsStatus

        Status for catalogs entities. Present in catalogs_feed values. When a feed is deleted, the response will inform DELETED as status.

         ||Name||Value||Description||
          |ACTIVE |"ACTIVE" | |
 |INACTIVE |"INACTIVE" | |
         
        
        {anchor:CatalogsTypeModelAnchor}
        h3. CatalogsType

        Type of the catalog entity.

         ||Name||Value||Description||
          |RETAIL |"RETAIL" | |

        {anchor:ConversionEventsDataInnerCustomDataModelAnchor}
        h3. ConversionEventsDataInnerCustomData

        Object containing other custom data.

        
        ||Field Name||Required||Type||Description||Enum||Example||
         |currency |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}String{noformat} | The ISO-4217 currency code. If not provided, we will default to the advertiser&#39;s currency set during account creation. Your campaign performance needs this field to report right ROAS/CPA. |  | USD
         |value |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}String{noformat} | Total value of the event. Accepted as a string in the request; it will be parsed into a double. For example, if there are two items in a checkout event, the value should be the total price. We recommend to use pre-tax, pre-shipping final value. |  | 72.39
         |content_ids |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}array[String]{noformat} | List of products IDs. We recommend using this if you are a merchant for PageVisit, AddToCart and Checkouts. For detail, please check &lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/before-you-get-started-with-catalogs&quot; target&#x3D;&quot;_blank&quot;&gt;here&lt;/a&gt; (Install the Pinterest tag section). |  | [&quot;red-pinterest-shirt-logo-1&quot;,&quot;purple-pinterest-shirt-logo-3&quot;]
         |content_name |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}String{noformat} | The name of the page or product associated with the event. |  | pinterest-themed-clothing
         |content_category |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}String{noformat} | The category of the content associated with the event. |  | shirts
         |content_brand |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}String{noformat} | The brand of the content associated with the event. |  | pinterest-brand
         |contents |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}array[ConversionEvents_data_inner_custom_data_contents_inner]{noformat} | A list of objects containing information about products, such as price and quantity. We recommend using this if you are a merchant for PageVisit, AddToCart and Checkouts. For detail, please check &lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/before-you-get-started-with-catalogs&quot; target&#x3D;&quot;_blank&quot;&gt;here&lt;/a&gt; (Install the Pinterest tag section). |  | null
         |num_items |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}Long{noformat} | Total number of products of the event. For example, the total number of items purchased in a checkout event. We recommend using this if you are a merchant for AddToCart and Checkouts. For detail, please check &lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/before-you-get-started-with-catalogs&quot; target&#x3D;&quot;_blank&quot;&gt;here&lt;/a&gt; (Install the Pinterest tag section). |  | 2
         |order_id |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}String{noformat} | The order ID. We recommend sending order_id to help us deduplicate events when necessary. This also helps to run other measurement products at Pinterest. |  | my_order_id
         |search_string |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}String{noformat} | The search string related to the user conversion event. |  | sample string
         |opt_out_type |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}String{noformat} | Flags for different privacy rights laws to opt out users of sharing personal information. Values should be comma separated. Please follow the &lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/limited-data-processing&quot; target&#x3D;&quot;_blank&quot;&gt;Help Center&lt;/a&gt; and &lt;a href&#x3D;&quot;/docs/api-features/conversion-overview/&quot; target&#x3D;&quot;_blank&quot;&gt;dev site&lt;/a&gt; for specific opt_out_type set up. |  | LDP
         |np |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}String{noformat} | Named partner. Not required, this is for Pinterest internal use only. Please do not use this unless specifically guided. |  | ss-company

        {anchor:ConversionEventsUserDataModelAnchor}
        h3. ConversionEventsUserData

        Object containing customer information data. Note, It is required at least one of 1) em, 2) hashed_maids or 3) pair client_ip_address + client_user_agent.

        
        ||Field Name||Required||Type||Description||Enum||Example||
         |ph |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}array[String]{noformat} | Sha256 hashes of user&#39;s phone numbers, only digits with country code, area code, and number. Remove any symbols, letters, spaces and leading zeros. We highly recommend this on checkout events at least. It may improve reporting performance such as ROAS/CPA. The string should be in the UTF-8 format. |  | [&quot;45df139772a81b6011bdc1c9cc3d1cb408fc0b10ec0c5cb9d4d4e107f0ddc49d&quot;]
         |ge |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}array[String]{noformat} | Sha256 hashes of user&#39;s gender, in lowercase. Either &quot;f&quot; or &quot;m&quot; or &quot;n&quot; for non-binary gender. The string should be in the UTF-8 format. |  | [&quot;0d248e82c62c9386878327d491c762a002152d42ab2c391a31c44d9f62675ddf&quot;]
         |db |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}array[String]{noformat} | Sha256 hashes of user&#39;s date of birthday, given as year, month, and day. The string should be in the UTF-8 format. |  | [&quot;d4426a0086d10f12ad265539ae8d54221dc67786053d511407204b76e99d7739&quot;]
         |ln |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}array[String]{noformat} | Sha256 hashes of user&#39;s last name, in lowercase. We highly recommend this on checkout events at least. It may improve reporting performance such as ROAS/CPA. The string should be in the UTF-8 format. |  | [&quot;7e546b3aa43f989dd359672e6c3409d4f9d4e8f155ae1e9b90ee060985468c19&quot;]
         |fn |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}array[String]{noformat} | Sha256 hashes of user&#39;s first name, in lowercase. We highly recommend this on checkout events at least. It may improve reporting performance such as ROAS/CPA. The string should be in the UTF-8 format. |  | [&quot;ec1e6a072231703f1bc41429052fff8c00a7e0c6aaec2e7107241ca8f3ceb6b2&quot;]
         |ct |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}array[String]{noformat} | Sha256 hashes of user&#39;s city, in lowercase, and without spaces or punctuation. User residency city (mostly billing). The string should be in the UTF-8 format. |  | [&quot;4ac01a129bfd10385c9278c2cf2c46fac5ab57350841234f587c8522a2e4ce36&quot;]
         |st |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}array[String]{noformat} | Sha256 hashes of user&#39;s state, given as a two-letter code in lowercase. User residency state (mostly billing). The string should be in the UTF-8 format. |  | [&quot;49a6d05b8e4b516656e464271d9dd38d0a7e0142f7f49546f4dabd2720cafc34&quot;]
         |zp |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}array[String]{noformat} | Sha256 hashes of user&#39;s zipcode, only digits. User residency zipcode (mostly billing). The string should be in the UTF-8 format. |  | [&quot;fd5f56b40a79a385708428e7b32ab996a681080a166a2206e750eb4819186145&quot;]
         |country |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}array[String]{noformat} | Sha256 hashes of two-character ISO-3166 country code indicating the user&#39;s country, in lowercase. The string should be in the UTF-8 format. |  | [&quot;9b202ecbc6d45c6d8901d989a918878397a3eb9d00e8f48022fc051b19d21a1d&quot;]
         |external_id |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}array[String]{noformat} | Sha256 hashes of the unique id from the advertiser that identifies a user in their space, e.g. user id, loyalty id, etc. We highly recommend this on all events.          |em |(/) |{noformat:nopanel=true}array[String]{noformat} | Sha256 hashes of lowercase version of user&#39;s email addresses. Used for matching. The string should be in the UTF-8 format. |  | [411e44ce1261728ffd2c0686e44e3fffe413c0e2c5adc498bc7da883d476b9c8, 09831ea51bd1b7b32a836683a00a9ccaf3d05f59499f42d9883412ed79289969]

         |client_ip_address |(/) |{noformat:nopanel=true}String{noformat} | The user&#39;s IP address, which can be either in IPv4 or IPv6 format. Used for matching. We highly recommend this for all events. It may improve reporting performance such as ROAS/CPA. |  | 216.3.128.12
         |client_user_agent |(/) |{noformat:nopanel=true}String{noformat} | The user agent string of the user&#39;s web browser. We highly recommend this for all events.         {anchor:ConversionTagResponseModelAnchor}
        h3. ConversionTagResponse

        

        
        ||Field Name||Required||Type||Description||Enum||Example||
         |ad_account_id |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}String{noformat} | Ad account ID. |  | 549755885175

         |num_removed_user_records |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}BigDecimal{noformat} | Number of removed user records.          |num_uploaded_user_records |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}BigDecimal{noformat} | Number of uploaded user records.          |is_received_invite |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}Boolean{noformat} | Indicates whether the invite/request was received. |  | null
         |user |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}BusinessAccessUserSummary{noformat} | Metadata for the member/partner that was sent the invite/request. |  | null
         
        {anchor:InviteStatusModelAnchor}
        h3. InviteStatus

        The current status of the invite.

         ||Name||Value||Description||
          |PENDING |"PENDING" | |
 |ACCEPTED |"ACCEPTED" | |
 |DECLINED |"DECLINED" | |
 |CANCELLED |"CANCELLED" | |
 |EXPIRED |"EXPIRED" | |
         
        
        {anchor:InviteTypeModelAnchor}
        h3. InviteType

        The type of invite. <br>'MEMBER_INVITE' is to invite a member to access your business assets. <br>'PARTNER INVITE' is to invite a partner to access your business assets. <br>'PARTNER_REQUEST' is to request access a partner's business assets.

         ||Name||Value||Description||
          |MEMBER_INVITE |"MEMBER_INVITE" | |
 |PARTNER_INVITE |"PARTNER_INVITE" | |
 |PARTNER_REQUEST |"PARTNER_REQUEST" | |
         
        
        {anchor:ItemAttributesModelAnchor}
        h3. ItemAttributes

        

        
        ||Field Name||Required||Type||Description||Enum||Example||
         |ad_link |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}String{noformat} | Allows advertisers to specify a separate URL that can be used to track traffic coming from Pinterest shopping ads. Must send full URL including tracking—do not send tracking parameters only. At this time we do not support impression tracking. Must begin with http:// or https://. |  | https://www.example.com/cat/denim-shirt/item012?utm_source&#x3D;Pinterest

         |age_group |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}String{noformat} | The age group to apply a demographic range to the product. Must be one of the following values (upper or lowercased): ‘newborn’ , ‘infant’, ‘toddler’, ‘kids’, or ‘adult’. |  | newborn
         |availability |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}String{noformat} | The availability of the product. Must be one of the following values (upper or lowercased): ‘in stock’, ‘out of stock’ , ‘preorder’. |  | in stock

         |size_type |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}String{noformat} | Additional description for the size. Must be one of the following values (upper or lowercased): ‘regular’, ‘petite’ , ‘plus’, ‘big_and_tall’, or ‘maternity’. |  | regular

        {anchor:ItemAttributesRequestAllOfImageLinkModelAnchor}
        h3. ItemAttributesRequestAllOfImageLink

        <p><= 2000 characters</p>
<p>The links to the main product images. Images should be at least
75x75 pixels to avoid errors. Use the additional_image_link field to add
more images of your product. The URL of your image_link must be accessible
by the Pinterest user-agent, and send the accurate images. Please make
sure there are no template or placeholder images at the link. Must start
with http:// or https://.</p>

        
        ||Field Name||Required||Type||Description||Enum||Example||
         
        {anchor:ItemBatchRecordModelAnchor}
        h3. ItemBatchRecord

        Object describing an item batch record

        
        ||Field Name||Required||Type||Description||Enum||Example||
         |item_id |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}String{noformat} | The catalog item id in the merchant namespace |  | DS0294-M
         |attributes |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}ItemAttributesRequest{noformat} |  |  | null
         |update_mask |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}array[UpdateMaskFieldType]{noformat} | The list of product attributes to be updated. Attributes specified in the update mask without a value specified in the body will be deleted from the product item. |  | [ad_link, adult, age_group, availability, average_review_rating, brand, checkout_enabled, color, condition, custom_label_0, custom_label_1, custom_label_2, custom_label_3, custom_label_4, description, free_shipping_label, free_shipping_limit, gender, google_product_category, gtin, item_group_id, last_updated_time, link, material, min_ad_price, mpn, number_of_ratings, number_of_reviews, pattern, price, product_type, sale_price, shipping, shipping_height, shipping_weight, shipping_width, size, size_system, size_type, tax, title, variant_names, variant_values]
         
        {anchor:ItemCreateBatchRecordModelAnchor}
        h3. ItemCreateBatchRecord

        h3. MemberBusinessRole

        The access level a member/partner has to the business. Values are case-sensitive.
<br> - EMPLOYEE: Can only view and access ad accounts you assign to them.
They cannot see details about other employees, external partners or other ad accounts.
<br> - BIZ_ADMIN: Have full control of roles and can add employees, external partners as well as grant ad account access.

         |country |(/) |{noformat:nopanel=true}Country{noformat} |  |  | null
         |locale |(/) |{noformat:nopanel=true}CatalogsLocale{noformat} |  |  | null

        {anchor:OauthAccessTokenRequestRefreshModelAnchor}
        h3. OauthAccessTokenRequestRefresh

        ||Field Name||Required||Type||Description||Enum||Example||
         |grant_type |(/) |{noformat:nopanel=true}String{noformat} |  |  [authorization_code, refresh_token, client_credentials]  | null
         |refresh_token |(/) |{noformat:nopanel=true}String{noformat} |  |  | null
         |scope |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}String{noformat} |  |  | null
         |refresh_on |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}Boolean{noformat} | Setting this field to &lt;code&gt;true&lt;/code&gt; will add a new refresh token to your 200 response, as well as the refresh_token_expires_in and refresh_token_expires_at fields. To see the structure of this payload, set the 200 response_type to &quot;everlasting_refresh&quot;. |  | null

        {anchor:ObjectiveTypeModelAnchor}
        h3. ObjectiveType

        Campaign objective type. If set as one of ["AWARENESS", "CONSIDERATION", "WEB_CONVERSION", "CATALOG_SALES", "VIDEO_COMPLETION"\] the campaign is considered as a Campaign Budget Optimization (CBO) campaign, meaning budget needs to be set at the campaign level rather than at the ad group level. ["WEB_SESSIONS"\] is DEPRECATED. For update, only draft campaigns may update objective type.

         ||Name||Value||Description||
          |AWARENESS |"AWARENESS" | |
 |CONSIDERATION |"CONSIDERATION" | |
 |VIDEO_VIEW |"VIDEO_VIEW" | |
 |WEB_CONVERSION |"WEB_CONVERSION" | |
 |CATALOG_SALES |"CATALOG_SALES" | |
 |WEB_SESSIONS |"WEB_SESSIONS" | |
 |VIDEO_COMPLETION |"VIDEO_COMPLETION" | |
         
        
        {anchor:OperationTypeModelAnchor}
        h3. OperationType

        Operation type to share a specific audience or revoke access to a previously shared audience

         ||Name||Value||Description||
          |SHARE |"SHARE" | |
 |REVOKE |"REVOKE" | |

        h3. PacingDeliveryType

        Ad group pacing delivery type. With ACCELERATED, an ad group budget is spent as fast as possible. With STANDARD, an ad group budget is spent smoothly over a day. When using CBO, only the STANDARD pacing delivery type is allowed.

         ||Name||Value||Description||

 |ACCELERATED |"ACCELERATED" | |

        {anchor:PinterestTagEventDataModelAnchor}
        h3. PinterestTagEventData

        Optional for VISITOR `audience_type`. With the Pinterest tag, you can use event data to capture event details from your website. This object lists all the available predefined event data fields in the Pinterest tag. You can include these event data fields as part of a VISITOR audience’ s `rule`; however, you **must** specify an `event` for the `event_data` fields to be evaluated. Besides what’s listed, you can also create your own set of `event_data` fields and define their usages or purposes according to your website needs. However, the benefit of using the predefined event data fields is that we can provide various metrics based on those fields' data.<br>Examples per `event` type:<br>`pagevisit`<br>"event_data": \{ "page_name": "My online store 123 \| view items \| shoe" \}<br>`signup`<br>"event_data": \{ "lead_type": "New release promotion" \}<br>`checkout`<br>"event_data": \{ "value": 116, "order_quantity": 2, "currency": "USD", "line_items": [ \{ "product_name": "Pillows (Set of 2)", "product_id": "11", "product_price": 48, "product_quantity": 1 \}, \{ "product_name": "Pillows, Large (Set of 2)", "product_id": "15", "product_price": 68, "product_quantity": 1 \} \] \}<br>`addtocart`<br>"event_data": \{ "value": 499, "order_quantity": 1, "currency": "USD", "line_items": [ \{ "product_name": "Red leather boots", "product_id": "3486", "product_category": "shoe", "product_variant_id": "JB11103000", "product_price": 499, "product_quantity": "1" , "product_brand": "My brand" \}\]\}<br>`watchvideo`<br>"event_data": \{ "video_title": "My Product Video 01" \}<br>`lead`<br>"event_data": \{ "lead_type": "Newsletter" \}

        
        ||Field Name||Required||Type||Description||Enum||Example||
         |currency |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}Currency{noformat} |  |  | null
         |lead_type |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}String{noformat} | Promotion code. For example, &quot;Newsletter&quot;. |  | Newsletter
         |line_items |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}LineItem{noformat} |  |  | null
         |order_id |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}String{noformat} | Order ID. For example, &quot;X-151481&quot;. |  | X-151481
         |order_quantity |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}Integer{noformat} | Order quantity. For example, 1. |  | 1
         |page_name |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}String{noformat} | Page name. For example, &quot;Our Favorite Pins on Pinterest&quot;. |  | Our Favorite Pins on Pinterest.
         |promo_code |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}String{noformat} | Promotion code. For example, &quot;WINTER10&quot;. |  | WINTER10
         |property |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}String{noformat} | Property. For example, &quot;Athleta&quot;. |  | Athleta
         |search_query |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}String{noformat} | Search query string. For example, &quot;boots&quot;. |  | boots
         |value |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}String{noformat} | Product value. For example, &quot;199.98&quot; |  | 199.98
         |video_title |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}String{noformat} | Video title. For example, &quot;How to style your Parker Boots&quot;. |  | How to style your Parker Boots

        h3. PlacementGroupType

        {anchor:PlacementMultipliersModelAnchor}
        h3. PlacementMultipliers

        This represents a mapping from placement to a bid price adjustment.

Multiplier values must be between 0 and 10. A value of 10 represents a 900% increase in bid price (from $1 to $10 for example). A value of 0 will stop distribution for this item on the specified placement in `MAX_BID` ad groups in `CATALOG_SALES` campaigns. All placement multipliers must be set at the same time. If a multiplier is not provided it is assumed to be 1 (no bid adjustment).

        
        ||Field Name||Required||Type||Description||Enum||Example||
         |PLACEMENT |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}String{noformat} |  |  [SEARCH, BROWSE]  | null

        ||Field Name||Required||Type||Description||Enum||Example||
         |questions |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}array[QuizPinQuestion]{noformat} |  |  | null
         |results |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}array[QuizPinResult]{noformat} |  |  | null
         |tie_breaker_type |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}String{noformat} | Quiz ad tie breaker type, default is RANDOM |  [RANDOM, CUSTOM]  | null
         |tie_breaker_custom_result |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}QuizPinResult{noformat} |  |  | null
         
        {anchor:QuizPinOptionModelAnchor}
        h3. QuizPinOption

         This field contains multiple options to a quiz question.

        
        ||Field Name||Required||Type||Description||Enum||Example||
         |id |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}BigDecimal{noformat} |  |  | null
         |text |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}String{noformat} |  |  | null
         
        {anchor:QuizPinQuestionModelAnchor}
        h3. QuizPinQuestion

        A specific quiz inquiry.

        
        ||Field Name||Required||Type||Description||Enum||Example||
         |question_id |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}BigDecimal{noformat} |  |  | null
         |question_text |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}String{noformat} |  |  | null
         |options |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}array[QuizPinOption]{noformat} |  |  | null
         
        {anchor:QuizPinResultModelAnchor}
        h3. QuizPinResult

        The result, and link out, based on the user’s choice.

        
        ||Field Name||Required||Type||Description||Enum||Example||
         |organic_pin_id |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}String{noformat} |  |  | null
         |android_deep_link |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}String{noformat} |  |  | null
         |ios_deep_link |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}String{noformat} |  |  | null
         |destination_url |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}String{noformat} |  |  | null
         |result_id |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}BigDecimal{noformat} |  |  | null
         
        {anchor:RelatedTermsModelAnchor}
        h3. RelatedTerms

        

        
        ||Field Name||Required||Type||Description||Enum||Example||
         |id |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}String{noformat} | First input term. For example, if you pass &quot;?terms&#x3D;clothes,workout&quot;, then id will be &quot;clothes&quot; |  | clothes
         |related_term_count |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}Integer{noformat} | Total number of related terms returned |  | 2
         |related_terms_list |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}array[RelatedTerms_related_terms_list_inner]{noformat} | The id of the advertiser. |  | null
         
        {anchor:RelatedTermsRelatedTermsListInnerModelAnchor}
        h3. RelatedTermsRelatedTermsListInner

        

        
        ||Field Name||Required||Type||Description||Enum||Example||
         |term |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}String{noformat} |  |  | clothes
         |related_terms |(x) |{noformat:nopanel=true}array[String]{noformat} |  |  | [&quot;shoes&quot;,&quot;cute clothes&quot;]
